loans.name: Morm

texts.en:
Morm T., 37, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples.

T. sells groceries and coffee, earning an income of USD 7.50 per day while her husband grows rice and raises cows to sell, earning an income of about USD 4 per day to help cover the family expenses. Every month the family has to spend USD 30 on food, USD 15 on public transportation, and USD 15 on their children’s education.

T. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase more groceries and coffee to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries and coffee to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnest D. is 45 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom attends school.  Her husband is a farmer.  Agnest is currently in the business of selling bread, sugar, and cooking oil in a shop at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more goods to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Julie Esi Mensima

texts.en:
Julie Esi Mensima A. is married and has four children. She has received schooling through senior high. Julie sells smoked fish at Abura. Her husband is a security man. Julie uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees. Julie will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Julie plans to improve the education of her children.

In the picture, she displays some of the fish she smokes for sale.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to smoke

loans.name: Las Morenitas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama Las Morenitas está localizado en la comunidad de Jaloxtoc, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México.  Este grupo está integrado por 5 mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas, las integrantes del grupo son la señora Juana M. M. va a comprar con su préstamo ollas, cazuelas y jarros para surtir su negocio, la señora Roció M. C. va a comprar un borrego para incrementar su pequeño negocio que empezó, la señora María O. M. va a comprar perfumes para dama y caballero, cosméticos para surtir sus pedidos, la señora Juana A. Vázquez va a comprar refrescos para surtir su negocio, la señora Paula V. A. va a comprar borregos para incrementar su negocio. La señora María O. M. es integrante del grupo Las Morenitas, ella tiene 37 años de edad, estudio hasta el 2º año de primaria, tiene su certificado de primaria la termino en INEA, ella es casada su esposo trabaja en el campo, tiene 3 hijas Angélica de 10 años de edad, Lizeth de 8 años de edad y Azucena de 6 años de edad todas sus hijas están estudiando la primaria. La señora María tiene su negocio de venta de perfumes y cosméticos de Jafra, Fuller y Avon por catalogo y solicito su préstamo para invertir en perfumes y cosméticos para surtir su negocio y tener productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes las señoras y las muchachas, inicio su negocio hace 6 años, cuando una señora llamada Huitzililla la invitó a vender y así es como se animo a vender por catalogo, le ofrece a sus clientes perfumes de dama y caballero, cremas, labiales, rímel, maquillajes, desodorantes etc. En su negocio le dan crédito de 1 mes, le encargan los productos, hace su pedido y cuando llegan los productos los reparte a sus clientes, el negocio está en Jaloxtoc en su casa y sale a ofrecer su mercancía, es ambulante tiene que andar cobrando y enseñando sus  catálogos con sus vecinas y conocidas, sale a vender. Su negocio es importante porque le deja ganancias y porque es más fácil ganar dinero y le deja ganancias más ingresos que andar trabajando y se siente orgullosa de vender estos productos porque la conocen y conoce a sus clientes, le deja ganancias y cosas buenas, ella encarga de mas productos en su pedidos para tener mercancía para ofrecerle a sus clientes, sus clientas son mujeres, muchachas, señoras, atiende de 10 a 45 clientes y es popular su negocio porque la conocen muchas personas, este negocio le ha ayudado para el bien de la familia, cuando su esposo no trabaja y no hay dinero, pues toma de las ganancias de su negocio para cubrir los gastos de la familia. 
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son que en el mes de mayo bajan un poco las ventas. La señora María quiere arreglar su cocina, hacerla de block porque es de lamina de cartón y sus sueños y esperanzas son seguir vendiendo, que su negocio siga creciendo que sus hijas sigan estudiando y este préstamo le va ayudan a invertir en el negocio y de ahí mismo las ganancias ayudan a sus hijas a que sigan estudiando. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a fundación Realidad “les damos las gracias por haber confiado en nosotros y garcais por no subar las tasas de interés”. Jaloxtoc  es un pueblo  muy bonito donde las personas son muy amables, se portan bien, en el campo siembran cebolla, maíz, sorgo
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called Las Morenitas.  It is located in the community of Jaloxtoc, Ayala, in the state of Morelos, Mexico.  The group has 5 female members who know each other and are neighbors.  The members of the group are Mrs Juana M. M. who will use her loan to buy pots, pans and jugs to stock her business, Mrs Rocio M. C. who will buy a lamb to increase her small business which she has started, Mrs María O. M. who will buy men's and women's perfumes and cosmetics to fill her orders, Mrs Juana A. Vázquez who will buy soft drinks to stock her business and Mrs Paula V. A. who will buy lambs to increase her business.

Mrs María O. M. is a member of the Las Morenitas group.  She is 37 years old and studied up to the second year of elementary school.  She has her elementary certificate, however, because she finished her studies with INEA (an institution which allows over adults who didn't finish their elementary or secondary school studies to do so).  She is married and her husband works in the fields.  She has 3 daughters, Angélica who is 10 years old, Lizeth who is 8 and Azucena who is 6.  All her daughters are studying at elementary school.  María has a business selling perfume and cosmetics from Jafra, Fuller and Avon catalogs.  She offers her customers men's and women's perfumes, creams, lipsticks, mascara, make-up, deodorants, etc.  In her business they give her 1 month's credit, her customers order their products, she makes her order and when the products arrive she distributes them to her customers.  The business is in her home in Jaloxtoc and she goes out door to door to offer her merchandise.  She goes out to her neighbors and acquaintances collecting payment and showing her catalogs.  Her business is important because it gives her income and because it is easy to make money.  She feels proud that she sells these products because she knows her customers well and it makes her money.  She requests more products in her orders so that she can have merchandise to offer her customers.  Her customers are women, girls and ladies.  She serves 10 to 45 customers and her business is popular because many people know her.  This business has helped her and her family when her husband doesn't have work and there is no money because she can take her earnings and cover their family's expenses.  The challenge which she faces is that in the month of May sales fall a little.

María would like to improve her kitchen.  She would like to build it from blocks because it is currently made from corrugated sheeting.  Her hopes and dreams are to continue selling, for her business to continue growing and for her daughters to continue studying.  This loan will be invested in her business whose profits will help her daughters to continue with their studies.  The group's members would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad “We would like to thank you for having put your trust in us and for not increasing your interest rates”.  Jaloxtoc is a very beautiful village where people are very friendly, get on well together and in the fields they sow onions, corn and sorghum.

loans.use: To buy perfumes and cosmetics to stock her business

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni N. lives in the Busega neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 8 children, all of whom are in school. Zaituni has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 4 years, and she works 7 days a week. She sells her product from home. Zaituni lives in a home that she owns. She doesn't have access to electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.


Zaituni has requested for a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenges for Zaituni include the rainy season and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to expand to the village of Luwero for charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anizah

texts.en:
Anizah H. A. is a married woman who lives in Isdang Bato, Brgy. Bagong Silang, Puerto Princesa City, Palawan. She earns her living buying and selling dry goods. Her husband Salipoden, who is 30 years old, works as a Buyer of dry goods to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 3 children who are between 9 to 8 years old. Anizah joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Anizah has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 14000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16 loan, she is borrowing PHP 24000, which she intends to use to pay for more purchase more stock so that she could continue to save up for future home repairs. 

Anizah H. A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Felipa Candelaria

texts.es:
Felipa es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutas”  del distrito y provincia D. Puno, tiene 60 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y tiene  02 hijos independientes.  La señora estudió hasta 2do D. educación primaria.

Viene trabajando  con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desD. hace 08 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. artículos artesanales.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma D. S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizará para comprar totoras (planta D. la región) y otros materiales para la fabricación D. sus balsas D. totora, trabaja junto con su esposo.

Su visión es mejorar el negocio y sobre todo mejorar sus ingresos.
	
Lo que le gusta D. su Banco Comunal es lo que gana sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Felipa is a member of the 'Las Kantutas' community bank in the district and province of Puno.  She is 60 years old, married and has two independent children.  She studied up to the second year of elementary school.

Felipa has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 8 years.  Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business selling hand-maD. fireworks.

Felipa is requesting a new loan for 700 Peruvian soles which she will use to buy 'totoras' (a native plant) and other materials for making her totora rafts.  She works together with her husband.

Felipa's vision is to improve her business and, above all, improve her profits.  What she most likes about her community bank is how much her savings make.

loans.use: To buy 'totora' (a native plant) and other materials to make her totora rafts

loans.name: Eunice Wangari

texts.en:
Eunice has been practicing farming in Olkalou for the last three  years.  She is 22 years old, married to Charles Mugo and they have one child.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

In future, Eunice hopes to enlarge her farming business and become a leading farmer in Olkalou town.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Ouch S., 50, is widowed and resides with her four children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. S. sells food, earning an income of USD 8 per day. Her three children are employed, earning an income of USD 4 each per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 75 on food and USD 65 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family to use

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 72 años de edad, es conviviente y vive con su familia en el distrito de Olmos, perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque. La zona es conocida en la zona norte del país por el cultivo del fruto llamado limón.

Se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura desde que era joven. Cuenta con un pequeño terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar frutas como mango y limón. Cuando llega el tiempo de cosecha las comercializa con las plantas procesadoras de la zona. El negocio le permite ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

Juan siempre se esfuerza para poder sacar adelante su negocio. Actualmente desea aplicar a su terreno diversos fertilizantes para lograr que las frutas que coseche a futuro se desarrollen de mejor modo. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Juan is 72 years old. He is in a common law marriage and lives with his family in the Olmos district, which belongs to the province of Lambayeque. The area is known in the northern part of the country for growing lemons.  

He has worked in agriculture since he was young. He a small plot of cropland where he grows fruit such as mangos and lemons.  When harvest time comes, he sells to the processing plants in the area. The business allows him to help support his family's daily budget.

Juan always works hard to be able to get his business ahead. At present, he wants to apply different fertilizers to his land so that the fruit he harvests in the future will develop in the best way. That is why he has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles to help him meet his goal.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his land.

loans.name: Palomas De La Villa Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Palomas de la Villa se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Cd. Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, está conformado por 5 mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas, ella son la señora Joaquina Godínez Rodríguez va a comprar con su préstamo maíz, platos, papel estraza, servilletas, cueritos, aceite para surtir su negocio, la señora Manuela M. Hernández va a comprar carnes frías, sopa maruchas, mayonesa, chiles en vinagre para surtir su negocio, la señora Mariana Z. Hernández va a comprar con su crédito  carne, platos, vasos, un comal para surtir su negocio, la señora  Maricela M. G. va a comprar leche, cuajo, frutas para su yogurt vasos para surtir su negocio la señora Aurelia C. V. va a comprar platos, maíz, carne, aceite, carbón para surtir su negocio de venta de pozole y tostadas, la señora Mariana Z. Hernández es la representante del grupo, tiene 29 años de edad estudio hasta el 6º. Año de primaria, ella es casada su esposo trabaja de albañil, ellos tiene 3 hijos Alondra tiene 8 años de edad estudia la primaria, Paloma tiene 3 años de edad y Joaquín tiene 13 años de edad ya no estudia se va con su papa a ayudarle a trabajar como peón de albañil, ella tiene su negocio de venta de taquitos de suadero, longaniza, carne enchilada los vende en la escuela primaria en la tarde, ella solicito su crédito para invertir en el negocio va a comprar carne, aceite, verduras, tortillas, platos, cucharas, ella inicio su negocio hace 5 años ella aprendió viendo como preparaban los taquitos, anteriormente vendía tostadas, tacos de arroz ya después le ofrecieron vender los taquitos le dijo un maestro que si quería vender  y acepto, ella inicia con un dinero que tenia de las colchas y lo invirtió en la comida para preparar los taquitos, ella también vende zapatos, colchas, ropa interior por catalogo sale a ofrecer sus productos con sus vecinos y familiares en sus tiempos libres, su negocio esta a una cuadra de su casa llega caminando a la escuela primaria para vender los taquitos. Su negocio es importante porque va cayendo dinero para sus hijos y para ir comiendo, su parte favorita de este negocio es despachar, tener muchos clientes y se siente contenta de ver que les gustan los taquitos que ella prepara con mucho gusto para los niños y que están satisfechos sus clientes que son los niños y los maestros, su negocio es popular  porque es muy conocido por los niños por el buen sabor de los taquitos, las ganancias de su negocio las utiliza para volver a invertir en la comida para seguir vendiendo, para pagar el préstamo, para sus hijos, para la escuela, ella quiere comprar un brasero y un comal para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y lo piensa lograr por medio del préstamo, Cd. Ayala le gusta porque es bonito hay mucho ambiente muchas personas transitan por la calle, hay balnearios el Axocoche y el Colibrí en estos balnearios nace le agua hay arroyos donde va corriendo el agua que nace, celebran la navidad en grande hay misas del nacimiento del niño Dios a las 6:00 y a las 8:00 de la noche ya después de las misas se van a su casa y en las calles arrullan a los niños Dios le canta y lo arrullan, dan cubetas, jícaras, canastitas con colación, su negocio ha ayudado a su familia a salir adelante con sus hijos, las mejorías que desea hacer a su vivienda son construir una nueva casa bien desde abajo y arreglarla bonito, sus planes y esperanzas para el futuro de sus hijos son salir adelante darles estudio a sus hijos y tener una mejor calidad de vida. La señora Mariana está feliz con este préstamo que le dan porque es una oportunidad que va a invertir en su negocio le va a ayudar mucho, las mejorías que desea para sus hijos son que estudien, que se superen y lo pienza logran con la ayuda de este préstamo como va invertir en el negocio de ahí va sacando para seguir comprando y para sus hijos. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad Gracias por pensar en nosotras y gracias a ustedes salimos adelante en los negocios, gracias por otorgarnos el crédito se les agradece porque nos prestan con bajo interés y que siempre están pensando en nosotros.
texts.en:
This group is called Palomas de la Villa and is located in Ciudad Ayala, Morelos state, México.  It is composed of five women who are neighbors and who know each other.  They are:  Joaquina Godínez Rodríguez who will use her loan to buy corn, plates, brown paper, napkins, pork skin and oil to stock her business; Manuela M. Hernández who will use the loan to buy cold cuts, Maruchan soups, mayonnaise and chilies in vinegar to stock her business; Mariana Z. Hernández who will use her loan to buy meat, plates, drinking glasses and a griddle to stock her business; Maricela M. G. who will buy milk, rennet, fruit for her yoghurt and glasses to stock her business and Aurelia C. V. who will buy plates, corn, meat, oil and charcoal to stock her pozole and tostada sales business.

Mrs. Mariana Z. Hernández is the group representative.  She is 29 years old and finished 6th grade.  She’s married and her husband works as a bricklayer.  They have three children: Alondra, 8, who is in elementary school, Paloma, 3, and Joaquín, 13, who doesn’t go to school anymore and goes to help his father working as a bricklayer’s assistant.

She has a business selling suadero (thin cut of beef from the brisket) taquitos, longaniza and meat with chili at the local elementary school in the afternoons.  She asked for a loan to buy meat, oil, vegetables, tortillas, plates and spoons.  She started the business five years ago.  She learned by watching how the taquitos were prepared.  She used to sell tostadas and rice tacos and later was offered the opportunity to sell the taquitos.  A teacher told her that if she wanted to sell them she could and she accepted.

She started out using money she had from the bedspreads and invested it in food to prepare the taquitos.  She also sells shoes, bedspreads and underwear via catalogue.  She goes out daily to offer her wares to neighbors and relatives in her free time.  Her business is a block from home; she walks to the elementary school to sell the taquitos.

Her business is important because it produces money for her children as well as food to eat.  Her favorite part of the job is tending to the customers and she feels happy when she sees how much her customers, who are the children and teachers, like the taquitos that she prepares so gladly.  Her business is very popular because it’s very well known by the children because of the good flavor of the taquitos.  She uses profits from the business to reinvest in the food to continue selling, to repay the loan, for her children, for school.  She wants to buy a charcoal grill and a griddle to provide better service to her customers and intends to do so thanks to the loan.

She likes Ciudad Ayala because it’s very pretty, has a nice ambience and there are many passersby in the streets.  There are two spas: Axocoche and El Colibrí.  There are springs here and streams where the water from the springs runs.  Christmas is celebrated in grand scale.  There are Nativity masses at 6 and 8 at night.  After mass people return home to lull the Baby Jesus; they sing to him and lull him.  They hand out little buckets, gourds and little baskets with treats.

Her business has helped the family get ahead with the children.  The improvements she wants to make to her house are to rebuild it from top to bottom and fix it up nicely.  Her plans and hopes for the future of her children are to get ahead and provide an education for them and to have a better quality of life.

Mariana is happy with the loan she’s getting because it’s an opportunity she’s going to invest in her business and it will help her much.  

The improvement she hopes for her children is that they study and improve and she feels they will accomplish this with the loan’s help because she will invest it in her business and from it will be taking out a little to continue to buy and for her children.

The group members would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad: thank you thinking of us because thanks to you we get ahead in our businesses.  Thank you for granting the loan.  It is appreciated because you lend to us at low interest because you are always concerned for us.

loans.use: To buy meat, oil, tortillas, vegetables, plates and spoons to stock her business.

loans.name: Claudia Nelly

texts.es: La señora Claudia tiene 30 años. Es madre de 2 hijos ha luchado para salir adelante. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que labora con esta actividad, por lo que es importante para ella. Ya que le gusta mucho su trabajo porque conoce a muchas personas, hace buenas relaciones y eso la ayuda a incrementar su lista de clientes, de esa manera sigue incrementando sus ventas. El financiamiento que solicita es parar capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas en general, refrescos, gaseosas, detergentes entre otras cosas. En un futuro le gustaría tener su propia distribuidora para abastecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Claudia is 30 years old. As a mother of two children, she struggles to get ahead. Claudia has been managing a store for more than four years, so this business is important to her. She enjoys her work because she knows many people. By establishing good relationships, she has been able to expand her customer base so that she can continue increasing her sales.

The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy candy, soft drinks, detergents, and other products. In the future, she wants to open her own distribution center so that she can provide for her customers.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy merchandise

loans.name: Raul Nicolas

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SACSAYHUAMAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Raúl; el tiene 28 años de edad y es soltero; el socio es arquitecto de profesión el trabaja en las distintas obras o proyectos que le soliciten, el socio es una persona bien alegre, responsable y le gusta mucho su carrera ya que trabaja con pasión cada vez que está a cargo de algún proyecto.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de una maquina de construcción (vibradora) para su trabajo y también para alquilarlo a las distintas obras que le soliciten.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Raúl belongs to the Sacsayhuaman Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Raúl is 28 years old, and he is single.  He is an architect by profession, and he works where he is requested on different jobs or projects.  He really likes his career because he works with passion each time he is in charge of a project.

Raúl is requesting the loan to buy a construction machine (vibrator) for his work and to rent out as requested for different jobs. 

He is happy with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy a construction machine (vibrator) for his work and to rent out as requested for different jobs

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Mr. Ra M. (pictured here) and his wife, Mrs. Sreypov Bun, have been married since 2000 and have one son and two daughters. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Mr. Ra M. asked for Kiva loan once, he now is asking for another loan of $300 to repair the house where he lives.

loans.use: to repair the house where he lives

loans.name: Cerlina

texts.en:
Cerlina D. is from the village of Malipayon, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 55 years old. Cerlina is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Cerlina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily canned goods, junk foods, biscuits, shampoo, soap & beverages in the local community. Cerlina has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 5000, Cerlina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Cerlina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Cerlina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, beverages & junk foods. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Cerlina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, beverages & junk foods.

loans.name: Maria Del Transito

texts.es: Maria Del Transito tiene un negocio de ferretería. Inicio hace 11 años, en donde ofrece una gran variedad de productos como tubos, llaves, candados, clavos, martillos, aerosoles, machetes, cerámica entre otros. Sus clientes llegan a comprar a su negocio ya que ella ofrece buenos precios y además Maria es muy atenta y cariñosa. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para ampliar en su inventario y poder comprar en los productos que sus clientes le encargan.
texts.en:
María Del Transito has a hardware store that she began 11 years ago.  She offers a wide range of products, such as pipes, keys, locks, nails, hammers, aerosols, knives, ceramic, etc.  Many customers prefer her store because she has good prices and is attentive and kind to them.

She is requesting a loan to expand her inventory and purchase the products her customers order.

loans.use: To buy pipes, keys, locks, nails, hammers, aerosols, knives, ceramics, etc.

loans.name: Soun

texts.en: Mrs. Soun, age 30, is a rice farmer who has been making a low income by planting rice crops on her own farmland for the past ten years. From her crop-growing business, she makes an average of $2.50 a day for daily expenses. In order to help support Mrs. Soun, her husband works in the construction field. To increase her daily revenue, Mrs. Soun has decided to apply for a Kiva loan to buy pig feed and a piglet. This loan will help her family situation to get better. Mrs. Soun has been married a few years but she doesn’t have a baby yet.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and a piglet.

loans.name: Ivan Alonso

texts.es: El Sr. Iván cliente que trabaja en el transporte público, pertenece al sindicato mixto de Transportistas trabaja en la línea de taxi trufis, con una experiencia superior a 5 años en el rubro y en la misma línea. Vive en la casa de sus papás ya que es soltero sin hijos, su mamá se encuentra en España y manda remesas para ayudar a su familia. El crédito es para completar la obra fina de la casa familiar del cliente ya que la casa esta ya construida solo le falta la obra fina, es deseo de el es poder terminar su casita y también el poder ver muy pronto a su Mama, es un joven trabajador y responsable con muchas ganas de seguir adelante agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Ivan works in public transit and is a member of a joint union of carriers; he works in the taxi-trufis line.  He has more than 5 years of experience in this field.  Since he is single and has no children, he lives with his parents.  His mom is currently in Spain and sends remittances to help her family.  This loan is to place the finishing touches on the family home which has been built, it just needs the finishing touches.  His wish is to be able to finish the home and to also see his mother real soon.  He is a hard working young man, responsible, and with a lot of desire to get ahead.  He is thankful to the institution for the support.

loans.use: To place finishing touches on family home.

loans.name: Bethy

texts.en: Bethy is 57 years old and is a married woman with 1 child. Bethy is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. She grows rice and corn. She also raises pigs to sell. Bethy works hard to help provide for her family's needs. She has requested a loan and plans to use it to purchase corn seeds, fertilizers and feeds. She hopes that this loan will help improve her businesses.

loans.use: purchase corn seeds, fertilizers and feeds

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 28-year-old business lady who has been in the fashion industry for three years, tailoring clothes. She is married and blessed with two children, ages 8 and 4. She is confident that within five years, she will be a well-established business lady. She hopes to expand her market niche. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for teaching her the art of saving. She wants 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en: Petronila is 74 years old and lives with her partner. She has five children who are 36, 38, 40, 42, and 46 years old. Petronila works three days a week selling soft drinks, water and other small things to eat at the site of the Incan ruins located in her town, Ollantaytambo. She is soliciting the loan in order to buy all types of soft drinks and water to sell to tourists who visit the ruins. Petronila is a very responsible woman and is committed to making all the necessary payments on time.

loans.use: to buy refreshments to sell to tourists.

loans.name: Alberta Georgina

texts.en:
Alberta Georgina, who prefers her middle name, is 54 years old and lives in Ibarra, Ecuador. She is single and lives alone although she has six adult children. Her oldest son is Juan Luis, 39, followed by daughter Geoconda, 37, son Jeferson, 35, son Walter, 31, son Javier, 30, and daughter Belgica, 27. Georgina has nearly twenty grandchildren. Georgina is calm and does not have a problem with anyone and she likes to support and help others when she can. 

Georgina is requesting a loan to support her two small businesses: painting ceramics, and selling women’s underwear. She began as a businesswoman by selling CDs and movies in Guayaquil, Ecuador, but quit that business because it was dangerous to sell in the streets of Guayaquil and she lost money to robberies and assaults. A few years ago, she moved to Ibarra and two years ago took a class in painting ceramics. Georgina enjoys this new work and says that it is a lot less stressful. This will be her first loan and she will use it to buy ceramics, paint, and underwear to sell. She believes the loan will help her cover her costs. Georgina’s dream is to continue prospering so that she can have a pleasant old age. She also would like to have her own storefront where she can exhibit her works.

loans.use: to buy paint and ceramics for her craft as well as women's underwear to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a Tok Tok (a motorbike with a cart attached) for her son to start a new career.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian lives in Uganda. She is single and has 3 children, one of whom is in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her elderly father). Lillian lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

Lillian has operated a business selling used clothes for over 10 years, working 7 days each week. Lillian sells her products in a shop at the retail level. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used clothes. Lillian generates additional income through a bar and rental rooms. The main business challenges for Lillian include thieves and seasonality. Her goals and hopes for her business are to start importing clothes, to sell at wholesale only and to build more rental rooms.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Asbeli Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Asbeli del Carmen, vive en una colonia muy bonita en donde las personas soy muy trabajadoras, ella es casada con el señor  Joaquín Antonio  y con quien procreo  dos hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad.

    Ella solicito el préstamo  para invertirlo en  la compra de  mercancía como son ropa, para damas, caballero, niñas y niños, en donde lleva  practicando  cinco años  y seis meses, en la que comenta que le va bien ya que  ha tenido un buen resultado.

   Para iniciar con esta actividad  lo animo su mama quien también se dedica a lo mismo  y así  apoyarse con un poco de dinero  y su esposo no se vea muy presionado con los gastos que se generan en su hogar.
 
   Lo único que desea es que logres  tener  un ahorro para  que con el tiempo tenga un negocio más grande, así  tener  un mejor ahorro para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Asbeli del Carmen lives in a very pretty town where people are very hard-working. She is married to Joaquín Antonio and they have 2 children that are still their responsibility.  

She has applied for the loan to buy merchandise such as clothing for women, men, and children. She has done this work for 5 1/2 years. She says that it is going well, as she has had a good profit.  Her mother, who works in the same activity, encouraged her to start her business.  It enables her to bring in a little money, so her husband isn't so pressed with the household expenses.  

All she wants is to manage to save, so that in time she can have a larger business, and so have more funds for helping her family get ahead.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell outside the community.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is a 49-year-old Lebanese widowed woman living with her three children. After the loss of her husband, she had to handle the entire family expenses. So she decided to start her own business to earn income and be able to support her family. She opened a lingerie shop where she sells underwear, nightclothes, etc. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1800 from Kiva's partner Ameen s.a.l. to further diversify her merchandise selection. She will purchase more underwear and nightclothes as she wants to satisfy her customers' demands. She hopes to expand her business in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase more underwear and nightclothes

loans.name: Mujeres Maravilla Group

texts.es:
La formación de este comité fue gracias a la señora Adelaida, pues ella contactó con sus amigas y vecinas del barrio y las organizo, y de allí surge el comité. Ellas son en total 21 mujeres, las cuales trabajan de forma coordinada, conjunta y dentro de un ambiente de respeto.
La señora Adelaida se dedica a la venta de cosméticos hace ya un tiempo, por lo que ya tiene una clientela bien formada, pues siempre muchas mujeres le hacen pedidos de los cosméticos que vende. Comenta que tiene mucha demanda por lo que le gustaría seguir invirtiendo en su pequeño emprendimiento. Además de eso nos dice que por medio de este trabajo ella ha logrado mantener y sacar adelante a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cosméticos, para que pueda surtirse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This group was formed thanks to Adelaida, who contacted her friends and neighbors in the neighborhood and organized them to form the group.  They are 21 women in all who work in a coordinated and unified manner, and in a respectful environment.

Adelaida has been selling cosmetics for a long time already, and because of this she already has a well-established clientele, since many women always order cosmetics from her.  She comments that because she has lots of orders she would like to continue investing in her small business.  She also tells us that she has been able to support her family and get them ahead with this job.

Adelaida is requesting the loan to buy cosmetics so she can stock her business and fulfill her customers' orders.  She thanks the Fundación [Paraguaya] for the opportunity it is offering her, since obtaining the loan will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Dourgham

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, single and lives with five family members of whom three work.

Dourgham has owned a barber shop since 2008. He has experience in this field and he has a deep understanding of local consumers and a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $2,400 loan to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: To pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita is a 59-year-old married woman with five children. She has been engaged in seaweed farming for five years. Esterlita earns 5,000 PHP per month with her business. She requested a loan to buy straw, wooden pegs and other materials for seaweed farming. She hopes to be successful in her business. Esterlita also plans to buy home appliances with her profit.

loans.use: to buy straw, wooden pegs and other materials for seaweed farming

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia, de 35 años, es una mujer alegre y muy amable. Convive con su pareja, con quien tiene un hijo de 10 años, además que ella ahora se encuetra en estado. Tiene una casa propia en donde vive en armomnia con su familia. El trabajo de Silvia, consiste en la venta de ropa, pues sale a vender entre sus amigos, vecinos y familiares, dejándolos a crédito las prendas que eligen y le pagan de acuerdo a la posibilidad económicas que tienen. Por otro lado vende de manera ambulante prendas en el mercado de su ciudad. Tiene cinco años trabajando de esta manera. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que hay movimiento económico a diario además de tener tiempo disponible para poder hacer algunas cosas en su hogar. Por ahora le esta yendo bien y espera poder consolidar su trabajo, además tiene en mente poner una tienda junto a su hermana ya que las dos se dedican a la venta de ropa. Este será el primer crédito con MFP, y espera que su grupo comunal sean responsables en el pago. Asimismo agradece la oportunidad que le dan de esa manera espera desarrollar su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará mercadería para seguir vendiendo además traerá de la ciudad de Lima algunos pedidos especiales que le hicieron sus clientes.
texts.en:
Silvia, 35, is a cheerful, very kind woman.  She lives with her spouse and ten-year-old son; she’s also 8 months pregnant at present.  She has a house of her own where she lives with her spouse and son.  

Silvia’s work is clothes selling.  She goes out to sell among her friends, neighbors and family members.  She sells the items they choose on credit and they pay according to their ability to pay.  On the other hand, she’s also a street vendor of clothes in a market in her city.  She’s been working this way for five years. 

What she likes about her work is that there’s daily economic movement as well as having time available to do some things around the house.  For now, she’s doing well and she hopes to consolidate her work.  She’s also planning to open a store together with her sister because they both are in clothing sales.

This will be her first MFP loan and she expects that her communal group will be responsible with the payment.  She also is grateful for the opportunity she’s given this way and she hopes to develop her business.  She will use the requested amount to buy merchandise to continue selling; she will also bring from the city of Lima some special items her customers have ordered.

loans.use: to buy clothes and accessories.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.   Claudia has a shop that sells electronic loads of GLOBE & SMART. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy electronic loads to sell.

Claudia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy electronic loads for mobile phones

loans.name: Talal

texts.en:
Talal is a 56 year-old man who is married with one son.  He is a taxi driver with a low income. Talal wants to make necessary repairs to his taxi such as: changing the doors, painting, changing the taxi tires, etc.  but he doesn't have enough to do this, so he needs to take a loan from Kiva partner FATEN. When Talal gets the loan, he will pay the expenses of making the necessary repairs to the taxi, this will increase the taxi efficiency and enable Talal to work extra hours to increase his income and provide to his family better living conditions. Talal is photographed in the picture.

About this loan product:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to repair the taxi.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Imelda has a shop that sells vegetables like carrots, bell peppers & cabbages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy vegetables to sell.

Imelda has been a member of HSPFI since 1999. In the future, Imelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Yasmin Rocio

texts.es:
La señora Yasmin Rocio es casada, tiene 19 años de edad, cursó los grados de educación primaria, se dedica ala confección de plateras de tipo polo, inició este trabajo como operaria y lleva 4 años de experiencia.

solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de telas e hilos, y mejorar la producción, espera en el futuro tener un negocio amplio y con variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Yasmin Rocio is 19 years old, married, and has an elementary school education.  She makes polo shirts and began this business as a worker and has four years’ experience.

She is asking for this loan to buy fabric and thread so she can improve her production.  She wants to have a larger business in the future, with a variety of products.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Paz Y Unidad Group

texts.es:
El comité "Paz y Unidad" se originó a traves de promociones que se realizaron en el barrio de las miembros. Todas son vecinas y amigas del barrio, se pusieron como objetivo trabajar, fomentar el espíritu solidario de cada una y llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
La sra. Margarita es la presidenta del grupo, ella se dedica en la venta de chipa (alimento tradicional de Paraguay), nos comenta que tiene muchas ganas de progresar y de trabajar para poder ayudar a su familia, ya que ellos son su razón de lucha. Uno de sus deseos es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma generar un poco mas de ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de almidón, manteca, huevos, condimentos y demás insumos necesarios para elaborar la chipa que vende.
texts.en:
The committee “Paz y Unidad,” or “Peace and Unity,” began through promotions that took place in the members’ neighborhood. They are all neighbors and friends in the neighborhood. They made it their goal to work, fomenting a spirit of solidarity among each member, and carry their program out to its fullest potential.

Margarita is the president of the group. She sells “chipa,” (a Paraguayan traditional food) [a cheese bread often made with corn or manioc flour]. She says that she is driven to make progress and to work to help her family, since they are her reason for fighting. One of her wishes is to continue growing to earn a little more income.

She is requesting the loan to purchase starch, lard, eggs, seasoning, and other ingredients necessary to make the chispa that she sells.

loans.use: purchase starch, lard, eggs, seasoning, and other ingredients to make chipa

loans.name: Sipriano

texts.en: Sipriano is a 52-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda with personal goals of educating his children, building a permanent home and buying a car. He has been a farmer for 20 years after getting capital from the sale of cows given to him by his father. His major hardships are seasonal weather and inadequate capital to purchase modern farming equipment. However, he has goals of buying land to grow crops, hiring employees to help expand his business and moving his business to a more permanent location. The purpose of the loan is to weed his garden and buy a milling machine.

loans.use: to buy a milling machine.

loans.name: Renel

texts.en: Renel has owned a engaged in farming business for eight years. He is married and has two adult children. Currently he provides for his family using the income gained from selling animals he has raised. Due to a lack of funds, he cannot develop his agricultural and farming efforts at the same time. Therefore, the purpose of the loan of P 40,000 is to buy seeds for planting in order to be a successful farmer. His future plans is to expand his business. Renel hopes that you will support him and thanks you in advance for this.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farming business

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz Elena se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 7 años de edad, y hace unos 12 años tiene una venta de helados que la trabaja junto con su esposo y así generan los ingresos para sostener los gastos de su hogar y sostener sus 2 hijos. La venta la iniciaron desde su casa pero gracias a que sus productos se vendían muy bien comenzaron a vender los helados en un carrito por todo el municipio, y así poco a poco su negocio ha venido creciendo brindándoles mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida. Luz Elena busca un préstamo pera terminar de pagar el congelador en donde almacenan los helados, comprar una licuadora e insumos para la preparación de los helados.

De esta manera su negocio seguirá creciendo y seguirá brindándoles los ingresos que se requieren en su hogar, de modo que sus hijos puedan tener una buena calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.

loans.use: Terminar de pagar el congelador en donde almacenan los helados, comprar una licuadora e insumos para la preparación de los helados.

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en: Mrs Lhagvasuren is 40 years old, with lives her husband and daughter, in own ger  in Zavhan province of Mongolia. Her Husband's Tumenhuu is security guard, and 40 years old.  Her daughter's named Ayush. She is a high school student, and 18 years old. In 2007,  She started her car oiling accessories business in the nearby trading center. Now she owns one rental counter in the trading center of the western region of the country. She is well known to costumers. She has already been many regular costumers and suppliers. She is planing to expand her business. She is a very hard-working, responsible women. She requesting 2 000 000MNT, to purchase a more oil and other material to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase a more oil and other material to increase her working capital

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 28-year-old married father of two. He is involved in welding and he operates in a trading centre in Kyotera town. He supplies his goods to builders around Kyotera and Kampala

Along side his welding business he also has a piggery project which enables him get an extra income for a living. He was motivated to start a piggery project by the desire to get income and also exercise his rearing skills. He hopes to use the loan to buy more pigs to boost his piggery project and also to buy some metals for his welding workshop.

He faces a challenge of transporting his goods from Kalisizo to trading centers since transport fares are high because the road network is poor. He is described as a hard-working man.

loans.use: to buy pigs for his piggery and metals for his welding workshop.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru: Это женщина Шоира. Ей 27 лет. Она замужем и мать троих детей. Шоира со своей семьей проживает в районе Б. Гафуров. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Он занимается ремонтом домов. Ее муж зарабатывает и помогает ей обеспечить семью. Шоира тоже старается зарабатывать на жизнь. Она работает комплектовщиком в цехе по производству самбусы (таджикские пирожки с мясом). Она сейчас собирается отремонтировать дом. Шоира обращается за кредитом, и за счет кредита хочет отремонтировать свой дом и улучшить жилищные условия. Ее надежды и мечты на будущее, жить в хороших условиях и обеспечить новые экономические возможности для своих детей.
texts.en: Meet Shoira.  She is 27 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She lives with her family in the B. Gafurov district of Tajikistan.  Her husband is currently working abroad, making a living renovating houses.  The money received from him helps provide for the family.  Shoira is also trying to make her own money.  At the moment, she wants to renovate her house.  For this reason, she has applied for a loan which will help her to improve her family's living conditions.  She has hopes and dreams for the future: she would like to enjoy good living conditions and be able to give her children some new economic opportunities.

loans.use: to renovate her house and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en: Dennis is a farmer from the town of San Jose Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 38 years old married with one child. He also raises chicken for supplemental income. He has been in the farming business for five years now. This is the main source of his income. Dennis is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and feed supplements for chicken. With this loan, he will be able to improve the productivity of his farm and thus augment his harvest and yield. As well, his chicken will grow well, assuring his good sales in two months. In the future, Dennis hopes to make his farming business more sustainable.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for coconut farm

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is married with 5 children, 2 in secondary school. He has received some basic training in entrepreneurship from World Vision. He started his motorbike transportation business 2 years ago after raising some funds from tobacco sales. He now wishes to buy a second motorbike. He has been able to raise some funds from the business toward the purchase, and the loan of US$450 from PEMCI is to make up for the shortfall. With the two motorbikes operational he will be able to repay the loan without fail. Motorbike transportation (known as Boda Boda) is emerging as a quicker alternative to bicycle transportation. The motorbikes are used to ferry passengers long distances that the bicycles cannot reach. This emerging alternative will have a very positive impact on the economy and the communities in the area.

loans.use: To Purchase A Motorcycle

loans.name: Firangiz

texts.en: Firangiz is 46-year old mother of two children who lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village. TShe began her cattle-breeding business three years ago. It is her only source of income and has enabled her to meet the demands of her family. Now Firangiz is requesting a loan of $700 to buy a pregnant cow, which will improve her business.

loans.use: To buy a pregnant cow

loans.name: Publio

texts.en:
Publio specializes in the cultivation and production of rice which has been profitable. He also raises cattle, but he is more incline into growing rice since this is a very profitable crop in this area.

Publio would like to finish harvesting his land and to better manage his business. This is the main area in how he would make use of this loan since due to lack of funds has been unable to do so. He has 30 years of experience growing rice in which he feels very comfortable in the production and management of such crop.

Publio is 49 years old. He is married. Together with his wife, they have been able to take care of their land responsibly. Due to this effort, they have been able to send their 2 children to school. Their home is made out of solely wood. Publio’s goal is to one day have more land for farming and to facilitate more jobs to the people in his community!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Publio se dedica a producir sus tierras directamente con la siembra y producción de arroz, llevando de neto su actividad. Además de dedicarse a la ganadería pero mucho mas inclinación se da a la siembra del mencionado cultivo, llevado de la mano lógicamente con la zona arrocera en que esta.

Publio quiere completar la siembra de sus tierras y darle un mayor y mejor manejo por lo que solicita el préstamo, ya que por falta de capital no loa podido realizar adecuadamente. Tiene 30 anos de experiencia por lo que hacen tener una mayor confianza en la producción y manejo del ya mencionado cultivo

Publio en la actualidad tiene 49 anos de edad, esta casado en donde junto a su esposa han llegado a trabajar sus tierras con responsabilidad, dando gracias a ese esfuerzo tienen a sus 2 únicos hijos, estudiando. Su domicilio es de madera, los objetivos de Publio es llegar a tener mas tierras para trabajarlas, cultivarlas y generar mas fuentes de trabajo e ingresos para la comunidad y de esa manera comprar otros artefactos faltantes en el hogar.

loans.use: Rice cultivation & farming suplies

loans.name: Minerva

texts.es:
Minerva, 36, is married with 4 children; her husband is a farmer. She has a grocery store in her house. She belongs to the Lourdes 1 group along with dona Eloina Fonseca Ozuna who also has a grocery store in her house. Both hope to use the loan to reduce the costs of their merchandise by buying stock for their stores in bulk and so increase their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

MINERVA, tiene 36 años, casada tiene 4 hijos, su esposo trabaja como agricultor y ella tiene en su casa una tienda de abarrotes, pertenece al grupo Lourdes 1 junto doñaELOINA FONSECA OZUNA que también tiene en su casa una tienda de abarrotes. Ambas esperan comprar con el préstamo mercaderías en el mayoreo para rebajar los costos de compra y así abastecer sus negocios y obtener más ganancias.

loans.use: Grocery store.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Business Description

Mariana has a grocery store, very well located on a main street, which she opened nine years ago with the help of her savings. She presently sells all kinds of basic needs products, and also has installed video game machines next to her store.

Loan use

She needs this loan to buy merchandise at a wholesale price, and to be able to renovate her store, which is long overdue.

Personal Information

She is 32 years old and has three children, two of whom study. Her house is made of concrete and her main goal is to make her business grow and ensure a good future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Mariana tiene una despensa, muy bien ubicada en una calle principal, la que abrió hace 9 años con la ayuda de unos ahorros. Actualmente vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad y además tiene video juegos que ha colocado junto a su tienda.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar más mercadería a precio de mayorista y poder así reacondicionar su local, que hace tiempo no lo acondiciona.

Información Personal

Ella tiene 32 años y tres hijos de los cuales dos estudian. Su casa es de cemento y su principal meta es crecer en su negocio y asegurar un buen futuro para sus hijos.

loans.use: Stock up on merchandise.

loans.name: Azmat

texts.en: Azmat P. is a mother of five children, all of whom are boys. All of them attend a local school, except the youngest one who is too young to attend the school at the present. Azmat hopes to give them a prosperous future and requests a loan of US$350 for her husband’s spare parts business. He owns a small shop in a busy city market. His business does well and now he wants to diversify his existing product line by adding car tires. He hopes to have a very well established business in the near future.

loans.use: Diversify the existing product line

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Skirts and sandals, halters and heels. As you can see, Fatuma Mbagau has a classy range of clothes and shoes. She established her clothing business in 2004 and expanded it to include shoes in 2006. Now Fatuma requires a loan of $200 to purchase additional stock, which she hopes will help her to increase her monthly profits of approximately $80.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation for women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To extend her range of clothes and shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is a trained nurse who established her business on her own. She is into the sales of pharmaceuticals. She is 39 years old, married with four children, and she is a member of LAPO. She needs the loan amount of $450 to buy more equipment and drugs to sell. She started her pharmacy 10 years ago.

loans.use: To buy more phamaceuticals and drinks to sell

loans.name: Ida

texts.es:
Mrs. Ida O. is a member of the “El Progreso” microfinance institution. She runs a pharmacy where she sells medicine and toiletries for the whole family. Her business is located in the central market of Huaraz, in the Ancash department.

With this loan of S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase medicine and toiletries.

Ida is a 54-year-old separated mother of one son, who is now a professional. She was separated from her husband when her son was only 5 years old. On her own, she has been able to provide an education for her son and help him get ahead in life. They both live together, and she works arduously so that her business can continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Ida pertenece al banco comunal "El Progreso", tiene como negocio una Botica en donde ofrece a sus clientes medicinas y productos de tocador para toda la familia. El negocio está ubicado en el Mercado Central de Huaraz, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará diferentes medicinas y productos de tocador.

Ida tiene 54 años, es separada y madre de un hijo que ya es profesional. Se separó de su esposo cuando su niño tenia la edad de 5 años y sola ha podido educar y sacar adelante a su hijo, viven los dos y sigue trabajando para que continúe creciendo el negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of medication and toiletries

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en:
Bahodur is 27 years old. He is married and has two children. His business is located at his house. He has a wide yard where he keeps his goods.

His business is to sell carpet of different sizes (1x1.5, 2x2.5, and 3x4). He has been engaged in this business for over 3 years. His two brothers are his business partners. They have families and live with him. They buy their goods from local workshops and they also bring carpets from Kairakkum, Tajikistan. In the photo, you can see that they have a wide assortment of carpets. (Bahodur is on the left, and his credit expert, Unusov, is on the right). It is their family business and they are a large and very friendly family. Two of his brothers sell carpets at the market and he sells his goods at home. They have many constant clients from further regions. Today they have fast turnover of their working capital.

They wish to participate In KIVA to increase the number of their carpets so they can attract new clients.

loans.use: Purchase new types of carpets

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
Magaly works daily in a small sales space from which she offers excellent fruits from all parts of the country. Given that she is the only person to offer this wide variety of products, she encounters a demanding range of clients and has decided to make improvements to her workspace with the goal of improving the quality of her service and her product display.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson Kiva volunteer.

La señora Magaly, se desempeña a diario en un pequeño espacio de ventas en el que oferta día a día excelentes frutas de todas partes de su país, debido a que es la única persona que ofrece estos productos y con gran variedad cuenta con una exigente gama de clientes y ha decidido mejorar las instalaciones de su espacio de desempeño diario a fin de mejorar la calidad de su servicio y la exhibición de sus productos.

loans.use: To improve workspace conditions

loans.name: Mamusu

texts.en:
Mamusu K. is 40 years old and married with five children. With an unemployed husband, Mamusu bears the biggest part of the responsibility of taking care of the family expenses.

She has been selling fish, rice, and vegetables for three years, but due to her lack of capital, Mamusu could not expand her business. In order to increase her income, she approached SMT for a loan of $300 (Le.800,000) to expand and diversify her business and also to rent a stall in the market.

loans.use: To increase stock for more income

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok M. is a villager in Wat Kdey village in Kampong Speu province. She is currently in the plantation business. She is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding in order to improve her family’s living conditions. Her husband, Mr. Phi Chon, is a subsistence farmer. Mrs. Sok M. is 36 and is the mother of three children. One of her children is employed in a garment factory and the other two are enrolled in a local school. Her husband is also pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Hoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoeurn C. owns a grocery store in Kraing Sromor village located in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a 33-year-old widow with two children, both of whom are too young to work or attend school. Mrs. Hoeurn C. is the head of the household, and her family lives in very poor conditions.

Mrs. Hoeurn C. needs to buy a piece of land to re-sell later at a better price. Unfortunately, she does not have enough money to do so. Thus, Mrs. Hoeurn C. has asked for a loan.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to re-sell later at a better price.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Five years ago, Lucila’s husband lost his job, so she had to start working. She decided to sell sweets from a cart outside a high school in her neighborhood. Lucila also crochets hair accessories. A woman taught her to crochet and since then she has offered her services to other people, who then sell the merchandise wholesale. Every week, Lucila crochets 20 dozen of these accessories. When the need is urgent, Lucila has to leave at night to offer her crochet services to workshops. She works 3 or 4 hours, but when they make a request, she will stay all night. The loan that she is requesting will be invested in her sweets cart. Lucila would like to put a store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 5 años, el esposo de Lucila se quedó sin trabajo, por lo que ella tuvo que empezar a trabajar. Fue así que decidió vender golosinas en una carreta afuera del colegio de su barrio. Asimismo, Lucila teje a crochet accesorios para sostener el cabello. Una señora le enseñó a tejer y desde allí empezó a hacer servicios de tejidos para otras personas, quienes reparten la mercadería por mayor. A la semana, Lucila teje 20 docenas de estos accesorios. Pero cuando la necesidad apremia, Lucila tiene que salir en las noches a hacer servicios de costura a talleres. Trabaja 3 o 4 horas, pero cuando se lo piden, se queda de amanecida. Los préstamos que ha solicitado le servirá para invertir en su carreta de golosinas. Lucila quisiera poner una tienda en su casa.

loans.use: Invest in sweets for her sweets cart

loans.name: Erick David

texts.es: Don Erick tiene 38 años de edad, habita en el barrio Sierra Maestra, es casado y tiene una niña menor que está estudiando en la primaria, su esposa trabaja en una tienda en el Centro Comercial Metrocentro se desempeña como encargada de limpieza  de esa forma apoya a su familia para salir adelante. Don Erick vende fritanga desde doce años se ha dedicado a las venta de comida, el comenzó los días domingo vendiendo sopa y luego se proyectó a la venta de comida lo cual le ha resultado. Con el dinero que está solicitando es para invertir en las mejoras del local así como invertir también en la materia prima del negocio para ofrecer a sus clientes sus ricos platos y poder mantener la variedad de alimentos.
texts.en:
Erick, 38, lives in the Sierra Maestra barrio, is married and has a young daughter who attends elementary school. His wife works as a janitor in a store at the Metrocentro shopping mall to contribute to the family's income. Erick has a food stand where he sells traditional fried food. He started twelve years ago selling soup on Sundays, and from there his food sales business took off. The loan he is requesting will be invested in improvements for the stand, and in purchasing additional ingredients to offer his customers his delicious dishes and maintain variety in his menu.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving food stand and purchasing ingredients

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel A. is 25 years old, unmarried, and has one child.  As a dealer of electrical goods, Samuel purchases electrical cables, extension plugs, lamps, speakers, transistors, and other devices at wholesale prices and resells them at retail prices to people in his area.  Samuel wishes to increase his savings in order to eventually purchase a refrigerator and telephone for his shop.  He has joined the Diligence Hands Trust Group, which allows members to guarantee each others' loans, in order to secure a loan.  Samuel has subsequently requested a loan of $875, which he will use to buy larger quantities of electrical goods at low prices for resale.

loans.use: To purchase increased stock of electrical goods.

loans.name: Voeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Voeun Srey was born in 1970 and now lives in Trapaing Thmor Village in Takeo Province where she and her husband, Mr. Pream Mam, are farmers who own a piece of land upon which they cultivate rice for a living. They have five children, one a garment factory, another a construction worker, and three others students at the local school.

Since their first child’s workplace is far from home, Voeun is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike for that child to commute to work in order to reduce transportation expenses.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her child to commute to work.

loans.name: Oqtay

texts.en:
Oqtay H. is a 42-year-old farmer who sells calves for meat production. He lives in the Internally Displaced Settlement of Bilasuvar City with his wife and four children.

Oqtay purchases baby calves at a low price, feeds them for 4-5 months, and then sells them to the local bazaar traders. He wakes up early in the morning and spends his whole day looking after the calves. Oqtay started his business in 1994 when financial hardship pushed him to start a business. Now he is applying for a loan of 1200 USD to purchase three calves and fodder. Your generosity will be very helpful.

loans.use: Purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Holmamad

texts.ru: Холмамад окончив свой первый кредит хочет получить ещё повторный займ.Он использовал кредит на расширение своего бизнеса по ткорму и продаже скота.Поняв что займ ему помог,он с радостью хочет продолжить свой бизнес.Следующий займ он хочет использовать для закупа крупного рогатого скота.Пока сейчас скот дешёвый , он хочет успеть его закупить.
texts.en:
After repaying his first loan, Holmamad would like to take out another. He used the first loan to expand his business, the fattening and selling of cattle. After seeing how the use of credit was such a benefit, he is happy to continue the business. He wishes to use the next loan for the purchase of large-horned cattle. Since the price of cattle is currently low, he hopes to be able to purchase them at this time.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle

loans.name: Simon's Group

texts.en:
Simon S. is a farmer with fields of bananas, beans, maize, cassava and potatos. He is even in a position to sell from his home where he has a stall selling cabbage, tomatoes, onions, carrots and spices, some from his lands while others he buys from fellow farmers especially those items that he does not grow.

This stall is mostly managed by his wife while he does most of the manual work with the help of hired manpower. He is our client. He is married with 5 children, all in school and he cares for 3 orphans thanks to loans that help to bring in an extra income. He has been able to buy a plot of land plus buying more household items for his family and now they are happy together. He needs a loan to buy more produce for sale.

loans.use: Buying more produce for sale

loans.name: Sean

texts.en:
Sean S., 27, pictured here with her husband, is the mother of three young children and works as a construction worker, building houses in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Every day she earns around US$ 2 to help cover daily expenses. Usually, she stays at home to take care of her children and cook for her family members. Her husband is a fisherman. He catches fish and sells his catch at the market to earn approximately US$ 3 per day.

To make more money, Mrs. Sean is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband. This bike can help her husband get started with a new business as moto-taxi driver. Moreover, they also can use it as transportation to go to their work place.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for transport

loans.name: Matrida

texts.en:
Matrida M. has been a cow and hen keeper in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 3 years. She belongs to the Majengo "A" street group loan (Group code 2001).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $300. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours. 

Matrida is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more hens and another cow to increase her livestock. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Matrida is 45 years old, married, and has three children: ages 18, 16, and 12.

loans.use: To buy more hens and a cow.

loans.name: Selepa

texts.en:
Selepa F., 39, is married with four children. She has many years of experience in the Cocoa business. She sells to villagers and the public five days per week.

She has 4 previous loan(s) with SPBD. Selepa expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). SPBD loans are Selepa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. Her husband helps out with the production of her ground cocoa.

loans.use: Purchase equipment needed for improving her business.

loans.name: Ruth Nory

texts.es:
Ruth Nory R. B. es una  joven señora de 29 años de edad, que actualmente vive con su esposo Alexander  y sus dos hijos: Alexandra y Edgar. Vive en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Abanico,  ubicada en San Isidro de Peñas Blancas, San Ramón, Provincia de Alajuela; reconocida como una comunidad amiga de la tranquilidad  y dedicada a actividades productivas tales como la agricultura, ganadería  y turismo.

Actualmente doña Ruth Nory es un ama de casa con deseos de iniciar su propio negocio, razón por la cual se ha propuesto establecer un salón de belleza, el cual brinde la mejor atención y servicio a sus clientes, por lo que se ha preocupado por tomar cursos de belleza para especializarse y estar en plena capacidad para atender su microempresa.  

Agrega que le llena de motivación y orgullo el hecho de tener su propio negocio. De esta forma podrá colaborar con los gastos familiares y ofrecer a su comunidad un servicio necesario, tomando en consideración que es una comunidad con muchos habitantes, quienes se ven en la necesidad de desplazarse hacia otros lugares para obtener ese servicio. Asegura trabajar con mucho esmero, dedicación y disciplina para llevar hacia delante el proyecto.  

Doña  Ruth Nory requiere un préstamo de ¢600.000 (seiscientos mil colones) para comprar una silla especial, una secadora, una plancha para cabello, un “lava cabezas”, un juego de sala y una cosméticos varios. Además de diferentes materiales de construcción para acondicionar una aparte de su casa para el desarrollo del proyecto. 

Ella forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Abanico, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Como socia ha recibido un total de 2 microcréditos que le han permitido crecer como empresaria permitiéndole comprar su máquina de coser y atender las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
Ruth Nory R. B. is a 29 year old young woman, that currently lives with her husband Alexander and their two children: Alexandra and Edgar. They live in a rural community in Costa Rica called Abanico, located in San Isidro de Peñas Blancas, San Ramón, Alajuela Province. It is well known as a friendly and peaceful community, dedicated to productive activites such as agriculture, livestock, and tourism.

Right now Mrs. Ruth Nory is a housewife with a dream to start her own business, which is why she has proposed to establish a beauty salon that would provide the best service and attention to customers. She has taken beauty courses to become specialized and to be in full capacity to meet the needs of her microenterprise.

She adds that the fact of having her own business fills her with motivation and pride. This will help with the family expenses and offer the community a necessary service, taking into consideration that this is a community with many people who must go elsewhere for the service. She assures that she will work with great care, dedication and discipline in order to move the project forward.

Mrs. Ruth Nory requests a loan of ¢600,000 (six hundred thousand colones) in order to buy a special chair, hair dryer, flat iron for hair, "hair washer", game room and a number of cosmetics. In addition, different construction materials in order to put in a seperate home for the project.
