She is a part of the Enterprise of Village Credit of Abanico (la Empresa Crédito Comunal de Abanico), one of the 100 organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. As a partner she has received a total of two microloans that have enabled her to grow as an entrepeneur, permitting her to buy a sewing machine and meet the needs of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Rukayat

texts.en: Rukayat is 27 years old and married with a child. She sells foodstuffs. She is requesting a loan of N 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El Comité D. Mujeres D. nombre Kuña Aty, se conformó en fecha 29 D. enero del 2.009, gracias a que la Directora General , la Sra. Juliana B. D. S. ,quien es artesana, se acercó a la Fundación Paraguaya informándose con respecto al programa y  D. la forma D. trabajo que tiene el Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya pasando al 2° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
El promedio D. crédito retirado por cada integrante es D. 470.000 Gs., lo cual va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como: venta D. bebidas, venta D. carbón, venta D. mercaderías para la despensa (arroz, azúcar, fideos, lácteos, panificados, yerba, etc.), venta D. ropas , venta D. miel, venta D. tabaco, etc.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Participan activamente en las reuniones semanales y trabajan en equipo demostrando espíritu D. compañerismo y solidaridad.
texts.en:
The group of women called Kuña Aty formed on January 29, 2009 thanks to the Director General, Juliana B. D. S., who is an artisan. She approached Fundación Paraguaya to learn about their Committee of Entrepreneuring Women program and the kind of work it involves. Once informed about the program, she assembled a group of 17 women. Already in their 2nd loan cycle, they have found that they work well together within the program.
The average loan per member is 470,000 guaranís. The money will be used in various activities, including the sale of beverages, coal, grocery items (rice, sugar, noodles, dairy products, baked goods, yerba tea, etc.), clothing, honey, tobacco, etc.
They all work to generate income and they help each other to achieve their common goals and those of Fundación Paraguaya. They actively participate in weekly meetings and work as a team, demonstrating a spirit of friendship and solidarity.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grocery items (rice, sugar, yerba tea, dairy products, baked goods, soft drinks, etc.)

loans.name: Alwafaa Group

texts.en:
The group name is Alwafaa; it is made of three ladies who are living in the region of the Bekaa, Lebanon. 

-Znoub is 55 years old and is married with seven children. Znoub has owned livestock for nine years. Thanks to her livestock, she also produces cheese and milk, and she plants tobacco. She requested a loan of 300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that Znoub has requested a loan. 
Znoub is respected because of her experience in dealing with her livestock. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. Znoub decided on doing her business because it is a demanding job in her region. In the future, she plans on expanding her livestock. 

-Rokia is 61 years old  and she has been working in agriculture for forty years. She owns livestock, which also produce milk. Rokia also plants tobacco, fruits and vegetables. Rokia requested a loan of 300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for her work and increase her livestock. This is the first time that Rokia has requested a loan. 
Rokia likes what she does. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She decided on doing her business because she continued her parents work, which she learned since she was young. In the future, she plans on improving her business. 

-Khola is  41 years old and is married with five children. Khola has been working in agriculture for 10 years; she owns livestock. She requested a loan of 300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to increase her livestock and purchase tools for her work. This is the first time that Khola has requested a loan. 
Khola is respected because of her experience. Her clients can be anybody from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t have a lot of cash. She decided on doing her work because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on improving her business. 


About Group Loans 
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: The Alwafaa group will use the loan to increse their livestock.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline G. runs a small food business in Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. She is married with four children ranging in age from 2 years to 11 years old.

For three years Jacqueline has sold food in Kigali, working long hours (6 a.m. till 11 p.m.) to contribute to the family’s finances. She currently earns 150,000 Rwandan francs (FRW) per month. Jacqueline has just requested her first loan through Vision Finance Company. She hopes that the 500,000 FRW loan will help her to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena T. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Filomena is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Filomena owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Filomena has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Filomena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Filomena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. Filomena is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks and as additional working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Filomena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks and as additional working capital

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: La señora Gloria vive sola con sus tres hijos, esta separada de su esposo y por tal motivo se esfuerza por salir adelante; ella labora en una residencia realizando labores domesticas como ingreso extra, ya que tiene su tiendita de abarrotes establecida desde hace un año. Esta solicitando este crédito para invertir en su negocio porque es el patrimonio familiar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Gloria lives with her three children. She is separated from her husband and therefore strives to get ahead. Sra. Gloria works at a boarding house doing household chores for extra income. She also runs a small grocery store that she started a year ago.

She is requesting a loan to invest into her business because it is the only asset she has available to leave to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy M. is from the village of Poblacion, Mambajao, Camiguin. She is forty-five years old and married with two school-age children. To make a living, Nancy owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a sari-sari (variety) shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Nancy has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $62 a month from these activities.

In July of 2009, Nancy joined HSPFI, a Kiva field partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Nancy is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. Nancy plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is requesting from KIVA lenders for financial assistance amounting to PHP13, 000 that will serve as her additional business capital to her general store located in their village at Centro 1 Angadanan, Isabela. She is already 39 years old and is already married to Alvin D. L. who chooses to venture in hog raising business. They have one daughter named Angel Grace, 5 years old and is studying in a nursery school in their town. Her family peacefully lives at the simple village of Angadanan.
 
AsiD. from maintaining her general store, Jovelyn is also employed in TV Cable Network Company in their town of which she is receiving a monthly salary of PHP5, 000 only. Her store is barely 4 months operating, she wanted the business grow in order to meet the needs of her family since her salary is too small and is not enough to support their daily immediate needs. With that she really desires that her loan will be granted.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Fiorela Aracely

texts.es:
Fiorela tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su padre en el caserío Valle Hermoso, cercano al distrito de Monsefú, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella es costurera, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace tres años. Empezó estudiando en un Instituto de Monsefú la carrera de corte y confección, ha terminado de estudiar hace un año y ahora se encuentra confeccionando faldas, polos, blusas y buzos para ofrecérselas a sus vecinos.

Su negocio le permite solventar sus gastos personales y también comprar algunos materiales; las piezas que confecciona son muy solicitadas por sus vecinos, los cuales la animan a seguir trabajando, ella desea aumentar su producción y buscar mercado en las ciudades de Monsefú y Chiclayo, por este motivo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1700 nuevos soles el cual piensa invertir en la compra de una máquina remalladora.

Fiorela sueña con expandir su negocio y hacer un taller de confección, vender sus productos en una tienda propia y darle trabajo a mujeres que, como ella, quieren ganarse la vida desarrollando su creatividad.

Ella es muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos que la consideran una chica responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Fiorela is 22, single, and lives with her father in the Valle Hermoso village near the Monsefú district, which is 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She is a seamstress. She has been doing this work for three years. She started studying for the career of design and production in the Instituto de Monsefú. She finished her studies one year ago, and now she makes skirts, shirts, blouses, and track suits to sell to her neighbors. Her business allows her to pay for her personal expenses and also to buy some materials. The pieces that she makes are very popular with her neighbors; they motivate her to keep working. She wants to increase her production and look for a market in the cities of Monsefú and Chiclayo. That is why she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first loan for 1700 PEN. She will buy a weaving machine. Fiorela dreams of expanding her business and having a sewing shop, selling her products in her own store, and giving work to women who, like her, want to earn a living developing their creativity. She is well known and highly thought of by her neighbors. They consider her to be a responsible and hard-working girl.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a weaving machine

loans.name: God Bless You Group

texts.en:
God IS Able is a group of 5 borrowers led by Anthony R.. He is 41 years old, married and has 3 children.
Anthony and his family live in Brewer Ville, Liberia.  

Anthony sells fish. He buys fish from fishermen and sells it to the residents of Brewer Ville. He has been running this business for 7 years and hopes to establish a shop for his business. He needs this loan in order to increase capital to improve and expand his business. In addition to improving his business, Anthony dreams of building a house for his family.

loans.use: He need this loan in order to increase capital to improve business

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Our client is Mario.  He is part of a communal bank consisting of sixteen neighbors who live in Cusco.  The group is called Santa Rosita de Lima, named after a virgin of Peru.  He is a native of Cusco and now lives in Santiago, Cusco.  He is 61 years old and is married with two children who are in college.

He buys all types of music CDs from distributors and sells them in Juliaca, Puno and Arequipa. He sells about 30-50 soles worth of goods per day, which is approximately $10-18 per day.  With this loan, he will buy more CDs to sell.

Mario appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: To buy CDs to sell

loans.name: Suos

texts.en:
Suos S. is 61 years old. She lives in Takeo Province with five of her children and her husband. To earn a living, she sells porridge and weaves silk clothes that she sells in the local market. She is able to make about US $3.00 every day. Her husband is a pump pipe worker. On average, he also makes US $3.00 per day. This couple is also supported by four of their children who are garment factory workers and waiters. 

Suos S. would like a loan of US $1000 to purchase more silk to weave silk clothes.

loans.use: To purchase more silk.

loans.name: Oseas

texts.es: Oseas tiene 44 años de edad y vive con su esposa quien se dedica a la venta de golosinas en el colegio Merino Ruiz muy cerca de su casa.  Tienen 3 hijos menores de edad aún están en el colegio.  Él se dedica a la venta de helados hace 5 años y su esposa lo ayuda en la venta de helados los días sábados y domingos.  Ellos cuentan con casa propia el cual están construyendo.  Ya tiene construida las paredes del primer piso y un cuarto construido.  Eso fue con el apoyo del gobiero con el programa de Bono Familiar.  Oseas tiene muchos sueños y objetivos, uno de ellos es darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijos.  Son una familia de buenas referencias personales y laborales.  Su cónyuge vende golosinas más de 10 años.  Con el dinero que solicitan es para la mano de obra para terminar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Oseas is 44 years old and lives with his wife who sells sweets at the Merino Ruiz School near their house. They have 3 young children who are still in school. Oseas has been selling ice cream for the past five years and his wife helps him on Saturdays and Sundays. They have their own house, which is being built. The first floor walls and one room have already been built with the support of the government through the “Bono Familiar” (“Family Voucher”) program. Oseas has many dreams and goals, one of which is to give his children a better quality of life. They are a family with good personal and work references. His wife has been selling sweets for more than 10 years. This loan will be used for labor to finish the construction of their house.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing Improvements

loans.name: Mujeres En Accion 3 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Elixana, 25, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro D. Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Mujeres en Accion (Women in Action), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Elixana lives with her father, husband, and three children (ages 4 to 7) in a small community north of San Pedro called Batey Euscarduna. Bateyes are poor rural communities that were built by sugar companies to house their field workers. Over time, the conditions in bateyes have deteriorated severely, with little to no access of potable water, electricity, or medical services. Despite these difficulties, Elixana operates a small food stand which focuses on fried foods. Some of the local favorites are johnnycakes and fried salami.

Elixana is very grateful for this loan, her fifth with Esperanza International. Since receiving loans, her travel time to purchase inventory has dropped drastically. Elixana used to have to travel often to buy supplies, but now she has enough cash flow to purchase a bulk supply that will last her a long time. Her loans have also helped her support her children, and Elixana hopes to send them to college so they can move up in society. Thank you for supporting Elixana and the Mujeres en Accion group!

loans.use: Flour, sugar, oil, meats, and coffee

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose M. V. tiene 34 años, es soltero, y no tiene hijos. El vive en Platanares con su padres, son tres miembros. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de terneros para engorde.  El trabaja con su familia mas que todo en ganadería. Es la primer vez don Jose se financia con FUDECOSUR. Este prestamo le ayudaría a aumentar ganancias en un futuro. El ha dedicado hace 5 años cuidar ganado. El no ha tenido otros creditos con Bancos formales. Le meta de el es que el prestamo le ayude a aumentar los ingresos economicos y así buscar cada día el bienestar de su familía. 

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Jose M. V. is 34 years old, single, and does not have children. He lives in Platanares with his parents, thereby making three members of his family. The loan he requested will be used to purchase calves for fattening. Jose works with his family in every aspect of raising cattle. This is his first time to receive financing from FUDECOSUR. The loan will help increase his earnings in the future. He has been raising cattle for the past five years. Jose has not had any other loans with formal banks. His goal is to use this loan to help him increase his income and provide for his family’s welfare each day.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves for fattening

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. sells fresh fish at Elmina near Cape Coast. Elizabeth has received junior high education. She is a widow and has two children. She is responsible for the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Elizabeth has been selling fresh fish since 2002. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to reinvest in her business to improve her capital base.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Chit

texts.en:
Chit C. is a low-income person who earns a living by selling fruit in Battembang Province. She is married and does not have any children. Her husband supports the family by selling fish. 

Chit C. wants to buy a piece of her neighbor’s land, which is in good location for farming. She has been trying to save money to buy the land, but her savings is not enough. Therefore, she would like a loan that will allow her to buy the land. She will earn additional income by renting her new land to crop growers.

loans.use: To buy land

loans.name: Jandark

texts.en:
Jandark is a 50-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She has been working as a home-based tailor for the past 20 years. She learned her occupation from her grandmother when she was very young. This business helps Jandark to earn extra income for her family.
Today, she is asking to borrow $1200 USD to buy a new sewing machine with more functions and options in order to develop her business and produce a variety of products for her customers.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina V. A. is a 42-year-old single mother who lives in San Francisco de Heredia, in the central valley of Costa Rica.

Over the past year, Carolina has worked as a distributor of catalogue products to catalogue vendors in Heredia. The vendors collect orders for clothing and other products from clients in communities throughout Heredia and then purchase products from Carolina in order to distribute them to community members.

The income she generates from sales is the main source of revenue for Carolina and her son. She plans to use this loan to invest in the purchase of catalogue products from a new catalogue company for which she has recently received an influx of orders.

In general, Carolina enjoys a high volume of sales. In a good month she expects to earn 5,100,000 colons; in a bad month, only 1,000,000. Her goal is to expand her business. She says her only obstacle is financial.

The loan consultant who has been working with Carolina describes her as an independent woman with a strong entrepreneurial spirit. Her goal is to expand her business and increase her income so she can pay for some maintenance work to be done on her car and her house.

loans.use: For the purchase of catalogue products to be sold at a later date

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn L. is from the village of Mobod. She is 25 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a "sari-sari" store business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for this activity. In 2009, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jocelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky owns a farm and tills it himself. He is 30 years old and is married with two children. He lives in Agusan Del Sur with his family. He wants to take this opportunity to save for his young children’s future. He wants them to be given a proper education.

Ricky is in need of financial support for his farm. His farm lacks inputs like seed and fertilizer so he applied for a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI to acquire these inputs. Having this loan would be truly helpful to Ricky’s farming.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna L. is from the city of Tarlac. She is 49 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns  a general store. Myrna has had this business for over three years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Myrna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Myrna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Los Toritos Group

texts.es:
EL GRUPO LOS TORITOS ESTA FORMADO POR TRES INTEGRANTES, LAS SOCIAS SON PERSONAS RESPONSABLES, DIMAMICAS Y TRABAJADORAS.

LA PRESIDENTA ES LA SRA. ALICIA TIENE CASA PROPIA LA COMPRO CON MUCHO ESFUERZO Y TRABAJO, SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. COMIDA, TIENE UN PUESTO D. VENTA DOND. OFRECE SUS RIQUISIMOS PLATILLOS, GENERALMENTE SUS CLIENTES SON LOS CHOFERES QUE HACEN SU PARADA EN SU PUESTO CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA INSUMOS E INGREDIENTES PARA LA ELABORACION D. SUS RIQUISIMAS COMIDAS.

EL SR. GUSTAVO Y LA SRA. MARIA   TAMBIEN SE DEDICAN A ESTA ACTIVIDAD D. LA VENTAS D. HAMBURGUESAS Y SALCHIPAPAS POR LAS NOCHES, ES UN  GRUPO MUY CONOCIDO TODOS ELLOS POR LA ACTIVIDAD QUE REALIZAN EN EL CENTRO D. SACABA POR LA VARIEDAD D. PLATOS QUE PREPARAN CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARAN INGREDIENTES PARA LA ELABORACION D. SUS PLATILLOS, ESTAN MUY AGRADECIDOS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
The “Los Toritos” group is maD. up of three dynamic, hard working, and responsible members. Alicia is the group’s president. She has her own home which she bought with a lot of effort and hard work. She sells food and offers a variety of delicious dishes. Most of her customers are drivers who stop at her stall. She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies and ingredients. Gustavo and Maria also sell food. They sell hamburgers and “salchipapas” in the evening. They are very well known in the city center, for the variety they offer. They will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients. They are all grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have place in them in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and ingredients

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
32-year-old Gina F. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has three infant children.

Gina owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years now.

Gina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is thankful that she doesn't have to borrow money from individuals who charge high interest rates.

Gina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her seventh loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es: Zenobia tiene 34 años, comparte su vida con su pareja y sus 4 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia. Ella trabaja vendiendo productos de belleza, actividad a la que se dedica desde hace 2 años atrás, pues le da buenos ingresos y la libertad de escoger el horario en el cual hacerlo. Además de esta labor,  se ha unido a un grupo de amigas para dedicarse a la artesanía, que lo realizan por pedidos. Zenobia nunca deja de lado los trabajos que se le presentan, pues es muy empeñosa y siempre trata de salir adelante. En un futuro le gustaría poner un negocio mas estable como un atienda o bazar, pero aún le falta mucho por concretarlos, por ahora continuará trabajando y vendiendo sus cosméticos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos de las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza para así poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Zenobia is 34 years old and shares her life with her husband and four children. They live together in their own home. Zenobia sells beauty products and has been doing so for two years. It provides her with a good income and gives her the freedom to make her own schedule. She has also joined a group that makes crafts from time to time. Zenobia never sets aside work. She is very enthusiastic and always tries to get ahead. In the future she would like to start a more stable business, such as a store or bazaar, but she still needs to solidify her plans. In the mean time she will continue to work, selling her cosmetics. This will be her first loan through MFP and she is committed to making her payments on time. She will use the money from this loan to buy beauty products in quantity, in order to be able to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia B. is from the village of Omonay, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Virginia is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Virginia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Virginia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Rozi's Group

texts.en:
Rozi is a citizen of a city called Lahore in Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and Punjabi foods. A very talented lady, Rozi owns and operates a clothes sales business. Her clientele base is her neighbors and relatives. She used to just sell to her neighbors, but later on her relatives came to see her collection and started giving her orders.
 
Her husband's name is M. M., who is a driver by profession. He drives a rented rickshaw and earns an income. His business has struggled because he has to share his earnings with the owner of the rickshaw. Therefore, Rozi has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount her husband will purchase his own rickshaw, earn more income, and work with more efficiency.

loans.use: To purchase a rickshaw.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is a member of Faulu Kenya.  She has been operating a mobile-money transfer business as well as a pharmacy for four years.  She also sells mobile phones.  She is a former employee of Telcom Kenya (a well-known company and provider of mobile phone service).  

Through her work experience, she has learned how to sell phones and also the mobile-money transfer business.  She wants to take out her first loan of 50,000 KES from Faulu Kenya.  With the loan, she will buy drugs to sell in her pharmacy and also buy mobile phones for resale.

loans.use: To buy drugs and mobile phones for resale

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha, de 39 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de Santa Rosa, ubicada en la selva tropical peruana, donde tiene su techo propio a base de adobe. Bertha no se desanima por no tener estudios inconclusos, es mas, fue motivo para que saque fuerzas y voluntad como toda mujer luchadora, ante obstáculos que se les pueda presentar. Fruto del esfuerzo constante, pudo tener un negocio en donde le da buenos resultados económicos, ya que cultiva y comercializa cacao, por el cual sus clientes se sienten satisfecho por la calidad de su producto. De todas maneras quiere seguir apostando en la actividad agrícola, ya que se siente feliz con lo que viene realizando, para ello recibe la ayuda de sus hijos en temporada de cultivo y cosecha, pero permanentemente trabaja con su querido esposo de lunes a sábado, a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde y su punto de venta lo realiza en los centros de acopio de su localidad a un precio justo. Su plan a futuro es diversificar de productos cultivando café y frutas cítricas, para que de esa manera aumente sus ingresos económicos. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus obligaciones de pago, además se siente fortalecido con su banco comunal, ya que todos trabajan en equipo. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abonos, con la finalidad de que le dé un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Bertha is 39 years old, married, and has 5 school-age children. They live together in the community of Santa Rosa, located in the tropical Peruvian rainforest, where they have their own home made of adobe. Bertha has not been discouraged by the fact that she did not finish her studies. Rather, this motivated her to gather her strength and will as a fighting woman, in order to face any obstacles that she encounters. As a result of her constant efforts, she has been able to develop a business that has good economic results. She grows and sells cocoa, and her customers feel satisfied with the quality of her product. She wants to continue working in agriculture, as she feels happy with the work she is doing. She receives help from her children during the planting and harvesting seasons, and she always works with her beloved husband. They both work from 7:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the evening, and they make their sales for a fair price at the local gathering center. Her future plan is to diversify her products by growing coffee and citrus fruits, and in this way, to increase her income. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she assures that she will comply faithfully with her repayment obligations. She also feels strengthened by her communal bank because they all work as a team. With the loan she is requesting, she plans to invest in the purchase of supplies and fertilizers, with the goal of adequately caring for her cocoa fields.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Ork

texts.en:
Ork A. is a 50-year-old resident of Kompong Tom Province. To earn a living, Ork sells cakes to village neighbors that she makes from her home.  She earns about $1.50 a day.  

She is married to a taxi driver and they have six children, two of whom are married.  Three of their children are employed: one daughter is a garment worker, another sells vegetable.  Their son works in construction.  The family always cultivates a rice crop during the rainy season.  Ork is requesting a loan to buy and raise a cow to be used to plow her farmland.

loans.use: Buy a cow.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 45 years old, and married with three children in school.  He earns a living by selling second-hand clothes. He has been running the business for 22 years. He registered to be a member of Faulu Kenya under the River Bank group. He now earns a better income, thanks to Faulu Kenya's financial support through loans. He has requested for a loan of 60,000 KES to buy six bales of blouses. He hopes to expand his business and help other people to stabilize.

loans.use: To buy six bales of blouses

loans.name: Abdukahor

texts.ru: Аманов Абдукахор проживает в районе Джиликул. Возраст, 37 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Образование средне - специальное, продавец. Вместе с женой занимается торговлей. Арендует торговую точку, где продает растительное масло. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 20 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Abdukahor A. lives in Jilikul. He is 37 years old, married, and has five children. He has a vocational education as a salesman. He and his wife sell both at home and in the market. At the market, he rents a shop where he sells vegetable oil. He has been doing this for twenty years. He is taking out a loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing sales

loans.name: Ala

texts.en:
Ala is a university student and a sister of five brothers and one sister, her father is an employee of the Ministry of Waqf and religious affairs. Three of Ala's brothers study in the university, Ala came to FATEN and took a $600 loan to pay her and her brother's tuition fees. 
Ala's family also own a piece of land where she and her mother work and grow vegetables to become a second source of income.
Ala's dad Ibrahim appears in the picture here as Ala is very shy to have her picture published.

loans.use: Pay tuition fees

loans.name: Dina Adjoa

texts.en:
Dina Adjoa N. is married and has 10 children. She has received schooling through junior high school.  Dina sells yams at Abura, which she has done for some time now. Her husband is a farmer.  Dina uses her income to pay for her children’s school fees and utility bills for the home.  Dina will use the loan to purchase more yams to sell at the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Dina Adjoa plans to further her children's education.

The picture shows Dina beside the yams she sells.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell at the market.

loans.name: Alma Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama ALMA, porque así se llama una D. las integrantes del grupo y les gusta el significado D. ese nombre. Está ubicado en el Estado D. México.  El grupo está conformado por  11 integrantes. Diana Verónica C. es integrante del grupo. Tiene 38 años, estudió para secretaria Ejecutiva, es comerciante y tiene en total 2 hijas mujeres.  Ella se dedica a poner uñas y venta D.  perfumes negocio que inició hace 20 años y 4 años en la colocación D. uñas. Solicita el préstamo para surtirse más D. perfumes y para las compras D. material para la colocación D. uñas. Sus clientas son vecinas D. la misma comunidad y conocidas. Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente ilusionada.   Quiere este crédito para poder hacer crecer sus ventas y tener más ingresos personales. También espera poder apoyar en los ingresos D. su hogar.
texts.en:
This group is known as ALMA [Soul], because it's one of the member's names and also because they like it's meaning. This group is in the state of Mexico and is maD. up of 11 members. 

Diana Veronica C. is a 38 year old member who studied to be an executive secretary and is a business woman with two daughters. She makes a living applying decorative fingernails as well as selling perfume. She has been selling perfume for 20 years and applying fingernails for 4. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase more perfumes as well as materials to apply the nails. Her clients are her neighbors from the community. As she requests the loan she is quite excited. She wants this loan to be able to increase her sales and have more personal income. She also hopes to add to the household income.

loans.use: Purchase inventory and invest in her business

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar es una joven soltera de 26 años, vive en casa de sus padres en compañía de sus 3 hermanos menores. Pilar trabaja en sociedad con su padre, instalando alarmas y  cercos eléctricos a pequeñas empresas  privadas  e instituciones publicas. Su padre es quien hace todo el trabajo de las instalaciones eléctricas y Pilar es la encargada de buscar nuevos clientes. De esta manera trabajan hace mas de 3 años en esta actividad, que le genera buenas utilidades. Lo que más le gusta de su labor, es que conoce muchos empresarios,  quienes le contactan con otras empresas y así aumenta su cartera de clientes. En adelante, anhela  ampliar su negocio y en un futuro no muy lejano prestar servicios a provincias. Es su 11avo crédito con MFP,  y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas de manera puntual. En su grupo comunal, es un cliente muy activo preocupado por el bienestar de su grupo. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará 200 metros de cables para instalación eléctrica.
texts.en:
Pilar is a single 26 year old young lady who lives at home with her parents and three younger brothers.  Pilar works with her father, installing alarm systems and electric fences for small private companies and public buildings.  Her father does all the installation work and Pilar is in charge of finding new customers.  They've been working this way for the past three years and the business generates good profits.  What she enjoys most about her work is that it allows her to meet many entrepreneurs, who put her in touch with other companies, allowing her to build her customer base.  In the future she wants to expand her business and in the near future, wants to provide provincial services.

This will be her 11th loan through MFP and she is committed to making her payments on time.  She is very active in her communal bank and always shows concern about the group's well being.  She will use the money from this loan to buy 200 meters of electrical cable.

loans.use: Electrical cable

loans.name: Mrs. Chev Hai Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loA. consists of thirteen people in Prey Chheu Teal village, TaK. province. Mrs. Chev H., 48 years old, is the village bank president, selected by the other members, who will use their portion of the loA. for different purposes. 

Chev H. weaves silk cloth for sale to support her family while her husband, Mr. TH. Oem, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow rice.  He sells rice to support his family and also sells recycled items. Since her business is going well, Chev H. would like to expand it. To pursue a daily income, she is requesting a loA. to buy more silk. She is a mother of five children, one is a driver who gets a small salary, one is a waiter and the other three attend public school.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Olinda Lucinda

texts.es:
La señora Olinda es socia del banco comunal Las Almendras del distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 68 años D. edad, tiene 2 hijos mayores, profesionales que ha tenido que sacar adelante gracias a su esfuerzo.
Olinda lleva año y medio trabajando con los créditos D. Manuela Ramos, que le ha servido para poder surtir su pequeña bodega que tiene en su casa, donD.  vive  con su esposo  y trabajan  juntos. 
Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 Soles, invertirá en la compra D. 3 paquetes D. gaseosas D. diferentes tamaños, 2 cajas D. galletas, 1 caja D. aceite D. ½ litro, 1 caja D. leche chica, 1 saco D. azúcar, 1 saco D. arroz, 1 caja D. aceite, 2 paquetes D. fideos, 2 bolsa D. detergente, ½ paquete D. lejía, 3 casilleros D. huevos, 3 paquetes D. papel higiénico, 2 cajas D. chocolate, ½ kilo D. canela y ½ kilo D. clavo D. olor.
La señora Olinda está contenta porque todavía tiene fuerzas para  poder seguir trabajando y eso le da cierta tranquilidad, agradece a Manuela Ramos por los créditos otorgados a su persona.
texts.en:
Olinda is a member of the Las Almendras community bank which is located in Calleria district, in Ucayali department.  She is 68 years old and has two grown-up children who are professionals.  She managed to get them ahead in life thanks to her hard work.

Olinda has been working with Manuela Ramos loans for a year and a half.  She has used them to stock her small grocery store which is located in her home where she lives with her husband.  They work together.

Olinda will invest this new loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles in buying 3 packs of soda in different sizes, 2 boxes of cookies, 1 box of oil in ½ liter bottles, 1 box of milk, 1 sack of sugar, 1 sack of rice, 2 packs of noodles, 2 bags of detergent, ½ pack of bleach, 3 packs of toilet paper, 2 boxes of chocolate, ½ kilo of cinnamon and ½ kilo of cloves.

Olinda is happy that she still has the strength to continue working and this gives her a certain amount of peace.  She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the loans that she has received.

loans.use: 3 packs of soda in different sizes, 2 boxes of cookies, 1 box of oil in ½ liter bottles, 1 box of milk, 1 sack of sugar, 1 sack of rice, 2 packs of noodles, 2 bags of detergent, ½ pack of bleach, 3 trays of eggs, 3 packs of toilet paper, 2 boxes of chocolate, ½ kilo of cinnamon and ½ kilo of cloves

loans.name: Dicko

texts.fr:
Madame Dicko B. est âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mère de huit enfants et vit dans une famille traditionnelle avec son époux ses coépouses et ses enfants. Elle est  installée dans la ville de Fana au quartier Fana coura relevant de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro république du Mali.
Madame Dicko B. n’a pas été à l’école. Elle fut mariée très tôt et commença avec le commerce pour ne pas rester à ne rien faire, petit à petit elle a pris goût au commerce jusqu'à venir chercher un crédit auprès de l’institution. C’est ainsi que Dicko est à son septième prêt individuel avec Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de supporter la concurrence actuelle.    
Elle se propose de payer avec ce prêt : des pagnes wax, des draps et quelques prêts à porter au grand marché de Bamako, qu’elle viendra vendre à crédit et au comptant à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en: Ms. Dicko B. is 35 years old and the mother of eight children.  She lives in a traditional family with her husband and her co-spouses and her children.  She is situated in Fana City, in the Fana Coura district, which belongs under Dioïla Prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (Republic of Mali).   Dicko did not attend school.  She was married early on, and she started off in commerce, so as to have something to do.  Little by little, she came to like commerce, as far as to come looking for a loan from this micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. Thus, she is now on her seventh individual loan at this institution. Her goal is to endure the current competition. With this loan, she intends to purchase:  wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), bed sheets, and a few read-to-wear items at the big market in Bamako (capital of Mali).  Then she will return to sell the goods, accepting cash or credit from a customer base composed of women and men.   She envisions making an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover the loan payments and to meet expenses related to healthcare, food, and schooling.  The rest will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Selling bed sheets and cloth

loans.name: Nicolás

texts.es: Nicolás M. es una persona muy responsable y emprendedora, quien a sus 65 años de edad,  trabaja muy duro para poder sostener su hogar. Él reside en San Marcos, municipio el cual se encuentra  en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Nicolás se dedica a la elaboración de quesadillas, las cuales son un tipo de pan hecho de harina de arroz, queso, crema, entre otros ingredientes más, y es un platillo muy tradicional de este país. Él  elabora las quesadillas junto a su esposa y posteriormente sale a venderlas de forma ambulante, y así mismo realiza pequeños pedidos para tiendas que compran cantidades un poco grandes. Nicolás, solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para invertir en la materia prima de las quesadillas y de esta forma elaborar mayor cantidad y de esta forma aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Nicolás M. is a very responsible entrepeneur who, at 65 years of age, works hard to provide and income for his family.  He lives with his wife and two children in San Marcos which is in the department of San Salvador.  

Nicolás makes "quesadillas", a typical dish in this country which is a type of bread made with rice flour, cheese, cream and other ingredients.  He and his wife make and sell them in the streets and also take small orders from stores who buy larger quantities.

Nicolás plans to use the loan to buy ingredients so he can make more quesadillas and earn more income.

loans.use: To buy rice meal, cheese and cream to make "quesadillas"

location.town: San Marcos, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Trust Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
49-year-old N. Hamiati is now seven years down the tough and challenging stretch in her dairy business in Terere-Mukono. It is a business she began with the influence of her late husband with whom she had four kids, who luckily are still in school, thanks in part to finances from this business.

N. says that before her husband prevailed upon her to take a hand in this business undertaking, she was more inclined to a commercial farming business, which at length she has dispensed with. The determined and diligent N. says this business generates about $22 weekly. With this loan, she says she is going to purchase maize bran to resell. This is her side business. N. belongs to the Trust Development Group-Mukono.

loans.use: To purchase maize bran to resell

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
La Sra. Eva pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 49 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando. 

El fuerza luchadora, que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de Juanes (plato típico) en las afueras de su casa, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad.  Trabaja también con pedidos de algunas entidades, para diferentes eventos, ya que su sazón es muy buena. Lleva varios años trabajando en este tipo de actividad y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes y pollos desviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad a sus clientes y  pensionistas.

Eva M, como le dicen de cariño, se siente muy orgullosa del trabajo que realiza día a día  y  agradece mucho al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Eva belongs to the Communal Bank “Los Eucaliptos” (The Eucalyptus) which is in the District of Tarapoto, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 49 years old, in a common law marriage, and the mother of two dependent children who are in school.

Eva is a strong determined woman who has always been known for her desire to succeed through her own abilities. She started her own business selling “juanes” (a traditional Peruvian dish) outside of her home. Over time she has become well-known among her customers and today she says she is doing very well in her business. Eva also receives orders from a few organizations for different events because her food tastes good. She has been working in her business for several years and is very happy to be doing what she does.

With this loan of 1500 PEN, Eva will buy supplies such as sacks of rice, eggs, native hens for making “juanes”, butchered chickens for making kebobs, and cooking utensils so that she can provide quality service to her customers and pensioners.

Eva M, as she is affectionately called, is very proud of the work she does day after day. She is extremely grateful to Manuela Ramos for contributing toward the completion of her dreams and goals.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & cooking utensils

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Sandra; La socia es conviviente,  tiene 25 años de edad, y tiene 1 hijo de 2 años de edad, la socia se dedica compra y venta de materiales de construcción, la socia compra todo tipo de materiales, desde, piedras, arena, ladrillos y agregados para la venta, ella desea aumentar su capital  y comprar bloker que es un tipo de ladrillos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción en especial bloker.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”. This bank is located in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

The member is Mrs. Sandra. She lives with her partner and is 25 years old. She has a two-year old son. She works buying and selling construction supplies. She buys all kinds of materials from stones, sand, nails, and aggregates to sell. She wants to increase her capital and buy bloker, which is a type of nail. This member is requesting a loan to buy construction materials, specifically bloker. 

The member is happy for the loan granted and she promises to make her repayments within the established timeframe.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to buy construction materials

loans.name: Yessica Del Milagro

texts.es:
Yessica tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia en la ciudad de Morropon en Piura, a unas cuatro horas de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Desde hace 3 años, cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida. Con su negocio, ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

En Perú, ha empezado la temporada escolar y Yessica desea invertir su crédito en la compra de más mercadería y suministros escolares, para vender en su bodega. También espera utilizar una parte para solventar gastos escolares para sus hijos menores. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Yessica es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Yessica is 32 years old, married and has three children.  She lives in her own home in the city of Morropon in Piura, about four hours from Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque Region.  For three years she has been running a small grocery store out of her house.  She sells daily consumption and basic needs items and different groceries to neighbors and customers in the area.  Business is going well and she is able to help her huband cover household expenses.

In Perú the school season has begun and Yessica wants to use the loan to buy more store merchandise and school supplies.  She also hopes to use part of the loan to cover school expenses for her minor children.  She has requested a loan in the amount of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

Yessica is a hard-working woman with a kind disposition.  The people who know her hold her in very high esteem.

loans.use: To purchase store merchandise

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia R. is from the village of Talisay. She is 59 years old, is married, and has four children: three of them are adults and the youngest is school-aged.

Delia owns and operates a business providing electronic services such as appliance repair and video karaoke assembly to the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Delia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC.

Delia is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used as tuition fee payment for her son. This will be her 11th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and also to support the education of her youngest child.

loans.use: to use as tuition fee payment for her son.

loans.name: Arayik

texts.en:
Arayik M. is 29 years old and he lives in Sevan, Armenia, with his parents who help Arayik in his business. Initially, he worked as a shop assistant in a food market, then had a shop where he sold mixed products.

Arayik now supports his family through his butcher shop, which he opened three years ago. Thanks to the income from his business, he hopes to expand in the future.

Arayik is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 AMD to buy some calves to raise and sell. This would be his second loan from Kiva and third loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy some calves to raise and sell

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras De La Q Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Sofía Victoria, es madre soltera con cuatro hijos a cuestas, uno D. ellos ya convive con su pareja, los otros tres aún dependen D. ella. Sofía Victoria es una señora alegre y a la vez responsable, por lo que el grupo comunal “Las Emprendedoras D. la Q” la eligió como presidenta. Eligieron el nombre D. “Emprendedoras” porque todas ellas se identifican como personas que impulsan el desarrollo D. su zona con su esfuerzo y trabajo; y “D. la Q” por que todas son vecinas D. manzana “Q”.
Sofía Victoria, se dedica a la venta D. dulces y bebidas gaseosas, en ocasiones venD. frente a su casa, a veces se transporta a los campos D. futbol a ofrecer gaseosa a los sedientos jugadores. En cuento pueD. aprovecha en hacer algunos trabajos extras, como participar D. actividades impulsadas por el gobierno que le generan un ingreso extra.
El sueño D. Sofía Victoria, es ver a sus hijos logrados como universitarios y que puedan sustentar sus gastos y los D. su futura familia, el prestamo lo usara para adquirir mercaderias para su negocio (bebidas, dulces)
texts.en:
Sofia is a single mother with 4 children in her charge, one of whom now lives with his wife and the other three still depend on her. Sofia is a happy woman and also a responsible one, for which reason the village bank "Las Emprendedoras D. la Q" elected her as president. They chose the name "Emprendedoras" [Entrepreneurs] because they all identify as people that push development in their zone with their hard work and efforts; and "D. la Q" [of the Q] because they are all neighbors on the Q block. 

Sofia sells sweets and sodas; sometimes she sells them in front of her house, other times she goes to the soccer fields to offer sodas to the seated players. When she is able, she takes advantage of other changes to make money, like participating in activities driven by the government that give her some extra income.

Sofia's dream is to see her children achieve college educations and be able to sustain their costs and those of their future families.

loans.use: to purchase drinks and candy for her business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. Emma has been in this business for 7 years now, and also earns additional income from coconut farming.

Emma requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of vegetables and fruits to sell.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María  tiene 55 años D. edad, ella es casada. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el distrito D. José Leonardo Ortiz a pocos minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

María cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por ella misma. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y clientes D. la zona diversos productos D. consumo diario, entre productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida  y con clientes fidelizados Con esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo en sostenimiento D. su  hogar.

María está solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa D. 2000 nuevos soles, este dinero lo utilizará para comprar mas mercadería para su negocio  D. esta manera María  satisfacerá la demanda D. sus ya que en los últimos meses se ha incrementado. 

Maria con mucho esmero y trabajo desea poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida, ella cuenta con buenas referencias, pues las personas que la conocen la describen como una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
María  tiene 55 años D. edad, ella es casada. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el distrito D. José Leonardo Ortiz a pocos minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

María cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por ella misma. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y clientes D. la zona diversos productos D. consumo diario, entre productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida  y con clientes fidelizados Con esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo en sostenimiento D. su  hogar.

María está solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa D. 2000 nuevos soles, este dinero lo utilizará para comprar mas mercadería para su negocio  D. esta manera María  satisfacerá la demanda D. sus ya que en los últimos meses se ha incrementado. 

Maria con mucho esmero y trabajo desea poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida, ella cuenta con buenas referencias, pues las personas que la conocen la describen como una persona tranquila y responsable.

loans.use: Compra de mercadería para su negocio.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
For the last 10 years, Rosemary has been practicing farming in Ndunyu Njeru town. She is 34 years old. She and her husband John have four children, all enrolled in school.

Rosemary was introduced to KADET Ltd by her friend, an existing KADET client. This will be her second loan. She repaid her previous loan of KES 30,000 in full and on schedule. 

She plans to use her new loan amount to buy a cow, purchase fertilizers, hire a temporary farm laborer, and buy chemicals to spray on her crops.

In the future, Rosemary aspires to practice large-scale farming in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: to buy a cow, purchase fertilizers, hire a temporary farm laborer, and buy chemicals to spray on her crops

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: Agé de 28ans, Yao travaille à togotelecom. Il veut bien assurer son devoir de père de famille c’est pour cela il ajoute à son activité principale une salle de jeux vidéo. Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter des jeux vidéo pour que les enfants viennent jouer en période de vacance.
texts.en: Yao is 28 years old and works in TogoTelecom. He wants to fulfill his duties as a father which is why he is adding to his main activity a video arcade. This loan will enable him to buy video games for children to come and play during school vacations.

loans.use: to buy video games

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is a married woman with 3 children, aged 22, 15 and 8. She lives in the town of Santa Josefa, Agusan Del Sur, with her family.

Madelyn is a farmer. She has been growing rice for 20 years now. She said farming is full of challenges but she is eager to earn for her family. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She hopes that this loan will help increase her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Kaidu

texts.fr: Moussa est le membre qui représenter coopérative KAIDU client d’ACB Depuis 2009  (Kaidu est une coopérative qui distribue les aliments dans les institutions tels que prisons, des écoles,…). Représenter par  Moussa, il a 39 ans, il est marié, et il a 2 enfants entre 5 ans et 16 ans.  Tous vont à l’école.  Il est né au Rwanda, et il a niveau d’éducation de 6 ans des études secondaire (A2).  Ce crédit est son premier  cycle avec ACB. Ils vont utiliser leur prêt pour acheter des produits agricole pour les revendre à l’un des écoles qui se trouve dans leur district .  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est être plus productif en utilisant le grain bien sélectionne, cherché autre marché pour distribuer les produit des ses  champs.  Il voudrait  fonder des usines dans le future, avoir les machines pour lui aider avec son activité, et avoir des vaches au moins pour chaque membre du groupe.  Pour sa famille il voudrait payer le minerval pour ses enfants jusqu’au niveau supérieur.
texts.en: Moussa is the representative member of the Kaidu C., a client of ACB since 2009 (Kaidu is a C. that distributes food to institutions like prisons, schools, …). Moussa is 39 years old and married and has two children between 5 and 16 years old. They both attend school. He was born in Rwanda and has had 6 years of secondary school education. This loan is his first with ACB. They are going to use their loan to buy agricultural products to sell to one of the schools in their district. His strategy to expand his business is to be more productive by using well-chosen grain and to find another market to distribute his field products. He would like to open factories in the future, to have machines to help with his business, and to have cows at least for each member of the group. For his family, he would like to pay for his children’s education through college.

loans.use: to buy agricultural products to sell to one of the schools in their district

loans.name: Kit

texts.en: Kit, 66 years old, is making noodles to sell. Her husband is a farmer. Their income is $2 per day. There is one daughter living with her who works in Phnom Penh as a cook with an income of $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $3 on electricity, $10 on transportation, and $30 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $750 to buy a motorbike for her daughter to use to travel to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Erastus

texts.en:
Erastus is 27 years old and married to Millicent.  They have two children, aged one and three years.  Erastus owns a cereals shop.  He has been in business for a period of three years, earning a monthly income of KES.12,300.

He is borrowing KES 50,000 from KADET LTD.  This is his second loan.  He intends to purchase bags of dry maize, beans, peas, rice, millet and sorghum.  The profits will be used to expand the business.  

He wishes to own a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase dry bags of maize, beans, peas, rice, millet and sorghum for resale

loans.name: Marta Cecilia

texts.es: Martha Cecilia se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Ella se levanta todos los días desde las siete d la mañana hasta las ocho de la noche, por lo que la mayoría de sus clientes son vecinos, amigos y familiares. El negocio lo empezó desde muy temprana edad y que le ayudaba a su mama, pues fue ella quien le enseño esta actividad. Actualmente Martha solicita este crédito para la compra de ropa, calzado, perfume, toalla, sabanas, bolsos y prendas.
texts.en: Martha Cecilia sells general merchandise.  She rises every day at 7am and goes until 8pm.  Most of her customers are neighbors, friends and family members.  The business started when she was very young because she used to help her mother who taught her the occupation.  Currently, Martha is asking for this loan to buy clothes, footwear, perfume, towels, sheets, purses and other items.

loans.use: to buy clothes, footwear, perfume, towels, sheets, purses and other items.

loans.name: United Youth Group

texts.en:
Naboth is single and has no children yet. He is a very hard working 32 year old Ugandan carpenter who does his business along one of the busiest roads in Bushenyi.  He makes chairs, wooden doors and windows, among other things.  He says his products sell at high prices due to the quality he puts into them at the workshop.  He has spent 4 years in this business, and is able to generate profits amounting to 100,000 UGX per month.

Naboth also has a banana plantation from which he gets additional income.  His dream is to build a good residential house.  He will use his loan to purchase more timber to make more furniture to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more timber to make more furniture to sell

loans.name: Lomas De San Pedro (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Lomas De San Pedro se reúne cada quince días en el  en el sitio las Palmas D. Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo de personas que hace 4 meses decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les ha sido de gran ayuda ya que han podido incrementar sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Holandina, tiene 56 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 5 hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Nuestra amiga para ayudarse y ayudar a su marido con los gastos D. hogar hace mas de 20 años puso un pequeño negocio en su casa en el cual se dedica a la venta de golosinas, helados, bebidas, ciertos bocadillos y comidas rápidas, ella también en su local ofrece entretenimiento ya que tiene cuatro mesas de billar hasta donde llegan sus clientes con la finalidad de entretenerse y disfrutar de un momento ameno,  trabaja todos los días con la ayuda de su esposo cuando él puede, nos cuenta que los fines de semana es cuando más clientes llegan hasta su local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su negocio va a comprar helados, gaseosas, golosinas y víveres para preparar los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde que inicio y le gusta cómo trabaja la institución. 

Su sueño es tener una tienda bien surtida.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Lomas de San Pedro” (The Hills of San Pedro) meets every 15 days at the site of Las Palmas in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that have received national and international recognition. This place is famous for its straw hats.

Four months ago, this group of individuals decided to join together and start this Communal Bank. Their union has been a great help in growing their small businesses. They engage in different business activities such as retail, services, selling food, and other trades.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Holandina. She is 56 years old, married, and has five grown children who are independent. Her husband is a farmer.

To help her husband with the household expenses, Holandina has managed a small business in her home for more than 20 years. She sells candy, ice cream, beverages, and certain snacks and fast foods. Holandina also provides entertainment at her establishment since she has four billiard tables for customers who want to pass the time and enjoy a relaxing moment. She works every day and has the help of her husband whenever he is able. Holandina says that the weekends are when most of her customers come to her shop.

This loan will be used to restock her business by purchasing ice cream, sodas, candy, and ingredients for preparing her dishes. Holandina has been with the Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys working with the organization. Her dream is to have a well-stocked store.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream, sodas, candy, and ingredients.

loans.name: Vakhobchon

texts.ru: Вахобчон занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Он женат и у него 1 ребенок. Он выращивает картошку и пшеницу. В этом бизнесе ему помогает его жена  и они вместе дружно работает. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свою прибыль. За полученный доход он хочет построит дом. Вахобчон запрашивает займ для в размере 7000 Сомони  для покупки семена, горюче смазочные материалы и скота.
texts.en: Vakhobchon is involved in growing agricultural crops.  He is married and has one child.  He grows potatoes and wheat.  His wife helps him in this business, and they work well together.  Vakhobchon wants to expand his business and maximize his profit.  He wants to use the resulting profit to build a house.  Vakhobchon is requesting a loan in the sum of 7000 Somoni to buy seeds, fuel-lubricant materials and livestock.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fuel-lubricant materials and livestock

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 24 years old, single and lives with his parents in the village where he plants and harvests corn and sells to traders. He wants to lift his family from poverty.  That's why he devotes himself to his corn farming business.  He has managed his corn farming business for over ten years and earned about PHP 37,000 with his last crop. 

Ronald wants to borrow PHP 50,000 to purchase seedlings, pesticides and fertilizer for his farm. He hopes to maintain his business to secure his family's  future.

loans.use: buy seedlings, pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Discapacitados En Accion Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Alberta tiene 54 años D. edad, es casada y tiene una hija que es independiente. Tiene 4 años con Edaprospo - Prosperidad y se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes como gaseosas, cerveza, detergentes, galletas y otros; tiene 20 años en este trabajo y comenzó vendiendo sin proponérselo porque cuando ella llegaba con gaseosa a su casa, sus vecinos empezaron a pedirle que les venda, al principio ella lo tomó como broma, pero luego se dio cuenta que sería una buena idea D. negocio y como ella deseaba construir su casa no vio mejor opción que vender gaseosas. También se dedica al lavado D. autos y cuenta con un año D. trabajo en este negocio, hasta el momento ya ha logrado construir su casa y los gastos que cubren sus ingresos están destinados a las necesidades del hogar y ahorros para alguna emergencia.

Su plan para el futuro es tener una cafetería o jugueria y lograr que su hija sea profesional; si tuviera capital lo invertiría en la compra D. insumos para jugueria o cafetería. Piensa usar el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. cerveza, se encarga D. pagar las necesidades D. su casa y su esposo el pago D. luz y agua; tiene 2 años con el grupo el cual esta conformado por 8 personas, y que se formó tras un acuerdo entre vecinos; el nombre lo pusieron debido a que la mayoría del grupo forma parte D. una asociación D. discapacitados. Ella lleva 3 años como presidenta.
texts.en:
Sra. Alberta is 54 years old, married, and has a daughter who is independent. She has been with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for four years. Alberta sells groceries such as sodas, beer, detergents, cookies, and other products. She has been in this line of work for 20 years and had no intention of getting into this business. When her neighbors saw her come home with sodas, they started asking her to sell to them. At first she thought it was a joke, but Alberta later figured out that it would be a good idea for a business. She had wanted to build a house, so she saw no better option than selling sodas. Alberta also manages a car wash, which has been in operation for one year. At the moment she wants to build her house, cover the necessary household expenses, and have some money saved up for emergencies.

Her plans for the future are to open either a cafeteria or juice bar. She also wants to see her daughter become a professional. If she has the capital, Alberta will invest in the purchase of supplies for a juice bar or cafeteria. She plans to use this loan to invest in the purchase of beer. Alberta and her husband need to pay for household necessities, such as electricity and water.

For the past two years, she has been part of this group of eight people that was formed in an agreement among neighbors. The name of this group came about because most of the members are part of an association for disabled people, where Alberta has served as president for three years.

loans.use: to buy beer.

loans.name: Njete Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Njete SHG Group in Western Kenya! Catherine is the facilitator of the Njete SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
