She has been a citizen of a city named Borewala, Pakistan, for the past 32 years. Her husband's name is N. M.. She has 4 kids: 3 daughters and 1 son. She wants to give her children a good education; that’s why she enrolled her kids in school and they all are in kindergarten.

This loan consists of 4 additional people: Shahnaz wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Shamim, Naseem, and Razia each want a loan to buy donkey carts for loading.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Shamim is seated first from the right in this photo.

loans.use: To buy goats for an animal-selling business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda P. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, and married with three adult children. To make a living, Imelda owns and operates a bakery. The main source of income for the business comes from baking and selling bread in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Imelda joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional baking ingredients. This loan will be her eighth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional baking ingredients

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel C. is single and has one child. He has no educational background. Samuel goes to the forest, cuts weak trees and branches of old trees and sells them as firewood at Abrodzirum near Shama-Kedzi, which he has been doing since 2007.

Samuel uses his income for payment of fees for the child and payment of utility bills. Samuel will use the loan to pay for equipment to enable him to improve the efficiency of his work. With the new profits from his expanded business, Samuel plans to save to take care of his child’s education.

loans.use: To pay for equipment to improve the efficiency of his work.

loans.name: Mary-Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 26 years old and lives in Barangay Bantay Solana, Cagayan, where most people make a living in agriculture. She is married to Romulo, a local farmer, and they blessed with three children: Ronel, who is 9 years old, Roderick, who is 7 and Marielle, who is 2. They have a good family life and everyone is happy despite their poverty. 

For the last year, Mary Ann has made a living selling vegetables and raising chickens. She works hard and is patiently trying to expand both businesses so that her family has a better life. She uses some of the income she makes from selling vegetables to buy feed for her chickens. Mary Ann is applying for this loan to buy more of the supplies she needs to run both of her small businesses.

loans.use: To buy supplies to expand two small businesses

loans.name: Modesta Alicia

texts.es: Modesta Alicia S. tiene la edad de 86 años, su estado civil es viuda, ella tiene varios financiamientos con Fundación León 2000, por lo que a pesar de su edad ha logrado, salir adelante con su negocio y pagar en tiempo y forma.  La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la elaboración de cosa de horno, prisionero y queques, hace mas de 25 años que se dedica a  este negocio, inicio por cu4enta propia, ya que por medio de su familia adquirió este  negocio que le proporciono la fama en su cuadra. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo maíz, leña, queso, mantequilla, huevos entre otros productos útiles. Su deseo es seguir adelante con su negocio para sufragar todos sus gastos.
texts.en:
Modesta Alicia S. is 86 years old. She is a widow who has taken out several loans with Fundación León 2000. Despite her age, she has been able to succeed in her business and pay her loans on time. She produces baked goods, such as pastries and cakes, and has been managing her business from home for over 25 years. The business was acquired by her family and has an established reputation in the community.

This loan will be used as working capital to purchase corn, firewood, cheese, butter, eggs, and other useful products. Sra. Modesta hopes to continue her business so that she can cover her expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase ingredients & supplies

loans.name: Lita

texts.es: Lita es una mujer dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 41 años, madre de dos hijos menores de edad, se dedica a la venta de naranjas, mandarinas, toronjas y limones, ella trabaja junto con su esposo, el negocio lo tienen en el mercado de Bellavista de esta localidad. Es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Ucayalinas” desde hace dos años. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles, que invirtió en telas, para coser blusas y venderlos, ahora Lita necesita un crédito de 2000 soles, que será utilizado para comprar  frutas al por mayor y posteriormente comercializarlas. La meta de Lita es tener una fuente de soda, y aumentar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Lita is a dynamic woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, which is in the region of Ucayali. Lita is 41 years old and the mother of two dependent children. She sells oranges, tangerines, grapefruits, and lemons. She and her husband work together at their business located in the market at Bellavista.

Lita has been a member of the Communal Bank “Las Ucayalinas” for two years. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles, which was used to buy fabric for making blouses that she sold herself. She is now requesting a loan of 2000 soles to purchase fruit in bulk to sell later at the market.

Lita’s goal is to open a soda fountain so that she can increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit in bulk

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is 36 years old and is married with five children. All her children are in school and she hopes to give them a quality education.

Roseline sells tubers of yam at retail prices to her customers and has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to sell her tubers of yam at wholesale prices in the future when she becomes the sole distributor in her community.

Roseline requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam to sell

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is married with two teenage kids. He lives in Melitopol along with his family. Oleg owns a small business selling men’s outerwear in one of the local markets of his hometown. He has been in this business for eight years. Presently, he has 20,000 Grivnyas in inventory. His monthly net profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas.

Oleg is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to increase his working capital. He always jokes he has chosen this type of inventory because men are easier to please. Oleg is planning to expand his venture even further. He is hoping to be able to use available lending services in the future as well. Oleg is planning to use his newly generated profits to finish remodeling his apartment.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.es:
La Sra. Miguelina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad del Dorado”, Distrito D. Moyobamba, Provincia D. Moyobamba, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 47 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, todos ya independientes.

El espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas D. salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio D. venta D. emolientes que son bebidas calientes preparadas a base D. plantas y semillas medicinales,  para ofrecer sus producto se dirige, por las diferentes calles D. la ciudad, a partir D. las 6:00 am a 9:00 am, así D. esta manera, poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo D. actividad. Lleva 12 años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.

En la actualidad, pese al tiempo transcurrido continúa con el mismo negocio, contando con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario consumen su producto y ella siempre atendiéndoles con el carisma y amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo D. S/ 2,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria D. emolientes como: alfalfa, cebada, uña D. gato, linaza, y otras plantas medicinales propias D. la región que los compra semanalmente. 

Esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Ms. Miguelina belongs to the Banco Comunal "La Amistad del Dorado", District of Moyobamba, Province of Moyobamba, Department of San Martin. She is married and 47 years old. She is the mother of 3 children, all now independent. The fighting spirit that has always characterized her and the wish to get ahead by her own means have served her to start her own business. She sells emolientes, which are hot drinks prepared with a base of plants and medicinal seeds. To offer her products, she makes her way through the different streets of the city, from 6:00 a.m. to 9:00 a.m. In this way, little by little, she has maD. herself very well known to her customers and today she tells us that this activity is going very well for her. She has been working at this business for 12 years and she feels very happy with what she does. At present, despite all the time that has passed, she continues with the same business. She now has a faithful clientele that consumes her product daily and she always serves them with the charisma and friendliness that characterize her. With this loan of S/2,000.00, she will buy ingredients for the daily preparation of emolientes, such as: alfalfa, barley, cat's claw, linseed, and other medicinal plants of the region which she purchases weekly. She is ready for anything and still feels a lot of strength to continue working and keep going ahead. She thanks the Movimiento Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase ingredients to prepare her emolientes.

loans.name: Santigie

texts.en:
Santigie B. is 38 years old. He is married with two children. His wife is a petty trader at the lorry park near her husband's store. Santigie deals in hardware tools and bicycle parts and has been in this business since he left school 15 years ago.  

He believes that his turnover is small because of the small amount of working capital employed in the business; however, the potential for increased sales for the type of goods in which he deals is very high. Sometimes he has to direct some of his customers to other dealers in the town especially when the gadget required is not in his store.

Because of the aforementioned, he wants to take out a loan from ARD so that he can increase his working capital. Santigie is believed to be honest and hardworking by his suppliers and friends. He wants to rent a bigger store at the lorry park when he gets the loan he is requesting.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose K. sells the hide of a cow locally called “wele” by Ghanaians. It is normally used in the preparation of soups and sauces; she also sells dried salted fish also called “koobi" or "kaco” that is also used for preparing sauces and soups. She sells at Elmina market near Cape Coast. Rose has received junior high education. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a fisherman.

Rose has been in this business since 1999. She helps her husband in the payment of utility bills and school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh cow hide and dried fish for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business for additional capital.

loans.use: to buy more fresh cow hide and dried fish for sale

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita P. is from the village of Santiago, Iligan City. She is 50 years old. Rosita is separated from her spouse and has three adult children. To make a living, she operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling scrap metal and other used products in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Rosita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Rosita from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rodrigo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Rodrigo Antonio J. H. tiene 32 años, es casado y su esposa trabaja como  guarda de seguridad la empresa de C Y B, ellos tienen dos hijos y viven en el Barrio Laureles Norte este es un barrio conocido por los altos índice de delincuencia que atacan a la comunidad que habita allí.

Agradecen el apoyo que les ha brindado los fondos Kiva este sería su segundo préstamo y lo solicitan para realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda debido a que hay una pared que es de plycem y la desea reconstruir de bloque, esto le dará a la familia una mayor seguridad para todos, es gracias a los fondos de Kiva que el señor J. ha podido componer poco a poco su hogar.
texts.en:
Rodrigo Antonio J. H. is 32 and married. His wife works as a security guard for the C Y B company. They have two children, and they live in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. This neighborhood is known for the high levels of delinquency, which attacks the community that lives there. They are grateful for the help of the funds that Kiva has given them. This will be their second loan. They are asking for the loan to make improvements to their house. There is a wall of cement board that he wants to rebuild with concrete block. This will give the family better security for all. Thanks to the funds from Kiva, Mr. J. has been able to repair his house little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a cement block wall

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda M. is a 42-year-old married woman who lives in Luke Wright St., Dumaguete City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by providing multimedia services to her clients.

Rhoda’s husband, Rafael, is a 41-year-old computer technician who helps his wife manage their computer-based business. They have three children who are between 5 and 10 years old. The two older children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Rhoda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in multimedia services. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000 from her business activities.

Rhoda is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 was used to fund operations of her multimedia services business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her ninth loan for PHP 20,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital in her multimedia services business. Rhoda is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. In the picture, Rhoda is with her husband at their business.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru: Туракулов Бахтиёр проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 37 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. У него среднее образование. Более 10 лет занимается растениеводством. Имеет небольшой земельный участок, где сажает дыню и арбуз. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений. Он хочет посеить и получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en:
Bahtiyor T. lives in the J. Rumy district. He is 37 years old, married and has 3 children. He has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture for over 10 years. Bahtiyor has a small plot of land, where he plants honeydew and watermelon. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers. He wants to plant and obtain a good harvest for sale.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 49 years old and married with seven children.  They range in age from one to 22 years old.  Five of them are currently enrolled in school.  He has run a farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, for the past ten years.  His primary source of income comes by selling maize, beans and meat, at the local market to middlemen.  He also operates his own butchery for extra income.  Overall, his main challenges are competition from other meat suppliers and access to good preservation equipment such as fridges. 

Justus requested this loan, his first through Juhudi Kilimo, for Kes. 31,200 to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He says that the extra income from this loan will improve his family by getting milk for home consumption and selling the surplus. Justus wants to be the main meat and milk supplier in his area.

loans.use: Purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Darleen

texts.en:
Darleen B. is from the village of Santiago, Gerona, Tarlac. She is 29 years old, married, and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Darleen owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Darleen has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Darleen joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Darleen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more baby items and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi sont toutes mariées dans des familles monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent dans le camp de garde de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues dans le camp à travers des relations de service (leurs maris sont des gardes), de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus dans le grand marché de Ségou. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Djenebou C. veut utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 400kg d’échalote en gros à Niono avec les producteurs. Elle revend à domicile et au grand marché de Ségou, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23 000FCFA qui sera utilisé à l’instar des autres membres du groupe pour  épargner et réinvestir dans leurs activités génératrices de revenus afin de devenir grossistes dans ce qu’elles vendent.
texts.en:
The members of this Benkadi group are all married and living in monogamous families. Their average age is 32 and they have, on average, 4 children. They live in the watchstanders' camp in Ségou (4the administrative region of Mali) and they met each other in the camp because all their husbands are watchstanders, but also through being neighbors. They also all work at income-generating activities at the big open-air market of Ségou. Wishing to grow their working capital, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third solidarity loan. Mrs. Djenebou C. wants to use her loan to buy 400 kg of shallots wholesale at Niono from the farmers. She resells them out of her home and at the big open-air market of Ségou, for cash or credit to a clientele composed essentially of women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 23,000 F CFA which will be used, following the example of the other members of the group, to put aside savings to reinvest in their income-generating activities so as to become wholesalers of the goods they sell.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy shallots wholesale

loans.name: Sope Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SOPE MAME DIARRA est créé il y a de cela 6 mois, il est composé de 08 femmes issues toutes du même village et âgées moyennement de cinquante ans exceptées les deux femmes accroupies Awa Michel D. et Dior S. âgées respectivement de 30 et 32 ans. Elles sont mères d'au moins de 2 enfants. Dans le village se trouve un grand marché hebdomadaire qui draine des milliers de personnes par semaine. Ce qui fait que l'activité commerciale est permanente dans le village et contribue au développement économique de la localité et ses environs. Le nouveau crédit du groupe de solidarité lui permettra de renforcer ses activités économiques et de les diversifier. Leurs activités s’articulent au tour de la vente de céréales locales, de produits halieutiques, d’arachide et de crème glacée pour les détentrices de réfrigérateur. 

Madame Fatou D., la présidente du groupe de solidarité, à droite de la photo en grand boubou bleu-fleurette est âgée de 56 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants. Elle est très dynamique et ne se lasse d’inculquer à chaque fois un esprit de solidarité de dans le groupe. Elle est vendeuse de produits halieutiques tels des poissons séchés, des poissons fumés, des huîtres et du charbon de bois. Avec son nouveau crédit elle va renforcer son niveau d’approvisionnement afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices et participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille par la nourriture et la bonne couverture sanitaire et scolaire des enfants.
texts.en:
The SOPE MAME DIARRA group has been created six month ago. It is composed of eight women, all from the same village and aged around 50, except for the two women shown seated in the picture, Awa michel D. and Diore S., who are 30 and 32 years old, respectively. They each have at least two children. The village has a big weekly market which attracts thousands of visitors each time. This provides for ongoing commercial activity and contributes to the economic development of the village and its surrounding areas. The new solidarity group will allow the group to bolster and diversify its enterprise. Their line of business includes selling local cereals, seafood, peanuts and ice cream (for those who own a refrigerator). Mrs. Fatou D., the group leader, shown on the photo on the right-hand side wearing a blue outfit with flowers, is 56 years old, married and the mother of nine children. She is very energetic and cultivates the solidarity spirit in her group. She sells sea food such as dried or smoked fish and oysters; she also sells charcoal. With her new loan, she would like to increase her stock in order to achieve a higher income and help improve life conditions of her family as concerns food, medical care and schooling of her children.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering, expanding and promoting the group's business activities

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina sells retail items such as pantyhose, stockings and socks in one of the markets in her home town. She has been running this enterprise for 12 years and has invested about 100,000 UAH in her business.

Georgina is seeking a loan of 12,000 UAH to increase the assortment of stock. She would like to offer her clients a better selection of merchandise ranging from cheaper brands to more exclusive and quality ones. Georgina can be characterized as a stable and solvent borrower. She has repaid all her previous loans without any delinquencies. 

She is married with two children. Her family lives in Mukachevo in western Ukraine.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of stock

loans.name: Nana

texts.fr:
Madame Nana T. est une femme mariée de 48 ans et mère de 5 enfants qui vit avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier  Hérémakono-Nord de Bougouni (troisième région administrative du Mali)
Madame Nana T. n’a pas  eu la chance de fréquenter l’école moderne. Très vite elle commença les activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat et la vente des tissus et draps de lit.  Elle a appris cette activité auprès de sa mère.
Avec 3 années d’expérience, elle maîtrise son activité et est très sollicitée.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, elle décide de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance  Soro Yiriwaso.
Après 1 prêt  solidaire, elle décida de venir  au prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser son prêt ci, pour acheter des tissus et draps de lits.  Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso. Sa clientèle est composée de population locale.
Avec ce prêt, elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 37 000 FCFA qui lui permettra d’améliorer son entreprise et à payer les intérêts.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nana T. is a married woman who is 48 years old and mother to five children. She lives with her husband and children in the Hérémakono-Nord district of Bougouni (Mali's third administrative region). Mrs.T. was not lucky enough to go to modern school. She started her income-generating activities at an early age, notably the purchase and sale of fabrics and bed sheets. She learned this business from her mother. With three years of experience she now masters her business and is in great demand. In her search for complementary financial resources she decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso. Following one group loan, she decided to go for an individual loan. She is planning to use this loan to buy fabrics and bed sheets. She gets her supplies in Burkina Faso. Her customer base is made up of local people. With this loan, she is hoping to make a monthly profit of 37,000FCFA which will allow her to improve her business and to pay the interest.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics and bed sheets

loans.name: Kipawa Group

texts.en:
Sharifa H., age 40, is married with five children ages 27, 23, 20, 18 and 14 years. For six years now, she has sold fabrics and sarongs by going from door to door, and also chapatti (an unleavened flatbread, similar to tortillas). She works from 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. daily and she is able to make a monthly profit of about $73

This will be Sharifa’s first Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. She hopes to obtain this loan to buy baking flour, cooking oil, and charcoal.

Sharifa will share this loan with her loan group, Kipawa Group, which totals nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture Sharifa is first on the left in the front row.

loans.use: To buy a sack of flour, cooking oil and charcoal

loans.name: Jaime Antonio

texts.es:
Don Jaime, habita en la comarca  Buena Vista de Nueva Guinea junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa y sus hijos: el mayor que tiene 13 años y el menor de todos de 10 años de edad. Jaime labora en su finca realizando actividades pecuarias y agricolas  las cuales son sus principales fuentes de ingreso, trabaja en conjunto con su familia en estas actividades. 

Actualmente esta  necesitando financiamiento para invertirlo en compra de ternero de desarrollo y asi aumentar su inventario ganadero y en el transcurso de un año poder vender animales de peso que generen mayores ingresos mejorando la economia del hogar. 

En su comunidad lo consideran como un hombre progresivo, trabajador y responsable,  espera ser beneficiado con el credito para poder hacer realidad su sueño, y mejorar sus niveles economicos que le permita brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jaime lives in the Buena Vista de Nueva Guinea region. He lives with his family, which is comprised of his wife and children. The oldest child is 13 years old, and the youngest is ten years old. Jaime works with livestock and does agricultural work on a farm. These are his main sources of income. He works together with his family doing these activities. He currently needs a loan to buy a calf to raise. That way he will increase his livestock inventory. In a year’s time he will be able to sell the animal by weight. This will generate greater income and improve the household’s financial situation. In his community he is considered to be a progressive, hard-working, and responsible man. He hopes to be granted the loan to be able to make his dream come true. He wants to improve his finances, which will allow him to give his family better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a calf to raise

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes J. is currently in the business of selling fish and charcoal near her home and is requesting a loan to stock bags of beans, rice and tomatoes to sell.  Agnes is 41 years old and is married to a peasant. She has seven children and four of them go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy sheep and goats to raise.

loans.use: Stock bags of beans, rice and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock more fish to sell

loans.name: Noel

texts.es:
Noel R. O. tiene 5 años de dedicarse ala siembra de maíz, el lo vende a un soda que vende todo tipo de comidas típicas basadas en maíz costarricenses.
Es el de Santa Fe de Alajuela, una comunidad conocida especialmente por su cercanía a la Frontera con Nicaragua.
El necesita preparar la huerta que tiene detrás de su casa para la próxima cosecha de maíz, es por eso que necesita un préstamo ¢603000 (seiscientos tres mil colones) para comprar todos los insumos necesarios. Espero mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa y la de sus 6 hijos.
El tiene 46 años y es socio de la  Empresa de Crédito Comunal Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Noel R. O. has been farming corn for 5 years. He sells it to a soda (a small restaurant in Costa Rica) which sells typical dishes made with Costa Rican corn.

He is from Santa Fe de Alajuela, a community especially known for being close to the Nicaraguan border.
He needs to prepare the garden behind his house for the next corn harvest. For this reason, he needs a loan of 603,000 colones (six hundred and 7 thousand colones) to buy all the necessary supplies. He hopes to improve the quality of life for his wife and their 6 children. He is 46 years old and he is a member of  Santa Fe community bank, one of EDESA’s 100 member organizations in Costa Rica.

loans.use: for harvesting corn

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine N. has been a poultry farmer for close to 8 years now. This is, by every measure, a lucrative and dependable means of earning a livelihood in many of Uganda's urban centers, where the consumption of chicken is growing by the day. The location of her business is in Kangulumira-Kayunga. This mother of 7 says her monthly cash returns are to the tune of shillings 5 million.  The rental business she also operates has been momentous in helping her consolidate her profits. Before she embarked on any of the above she was selling garments. With this loan she says she is going to buy more young chicks.

loans.use: To purchase more young chicks.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita G. is from the village of Sinara Alto,Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Lolita is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as canned goods, sugar, milk, coffee, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to provide additional capital for her business. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Lolita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Luz Idalia

texts.es:
la señora Luz Idalia R. tiene de 49 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos, los cuales los tiene estudiando.
sus hijos le ayudan en la limpieza de la casa.
Luz Idalia sale a vender su ropa de manera ambulante.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa interior, jeans, camisas y blusas. tiene muchos clientes que le compran al credito y le estan encargando ropa para la navidad, en esta epoca es cuando ella mas vende su mercaderia.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar y los gastos escolares de sus hijos.
Su mayor deseo es que sus hijos se graduen del colegio y que sigan estudiando en la universidad para que sean buenos profesionales y hombres de bien.
texts.en:
Luz Idalia R. is 49 years of age. She is a single mother and lives with her two sons whom she has in school. Her sons help out at home with the cleaning. 

Luz Idalia sells clothing as a street vendor. She will use the loan to purchase underwear, jeans, shirts and blouses. She has many customers who buy from her on credit and now they are ordering clothing for Christmas. This is the season when she sells more merchandise. 

She needs the earnings to cover household expenses and the costs of schooling her children. Her greatest wish is that her sons would graduate from high school and continue studying at a university so that they may be good professionals and decent men.

loans.use: To purchase underwear, jeans, shirts, blouses

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Хочиев Исмоил проживает в районе Вахдат. Ему 35 лет. Женат. Отец троих детей. Образование среднее. Работает на центральном рынке района. Имеет небольшую столовую. Работа приносит доход, который дает возможность обеспечить семью. В этой области уже четыре года. Кредит берет для ремонта столовой. Это поможет ему улучшить качество обслуживания и привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en: Ismoil H. lives in Vahdat.  He is 35 years old, married, and the father of three children.  He has a high school education.  He owns a small café in the area’s central market.  This work provides the income which supports the family.  He has been doing this for four years.  He is taking out a loan to repair the dining room.  This will help him improve the quality of service he offers and to attract new customers.

loans.use: Renovate a cafe

loans.name: Greicie Edith

texts.es:
Greicie es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Motupe, una zona conocida a nivel regional por sus festividades religiosas, es una zona medianamente comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de primera necesidad, entre abarrotes, verduras y demás perecibles. Su clientela prefiere su negocio ya que siempre brinda productos de calidad y un buen trato, el negocio le permite ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Greicie desea adquirir más productos para ampliar su negocio y satisfacer a la demanda con la que cuenta. Para ello ha creído coveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Greicie is a 35-year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in the Motupe district, a zone that is well-known for its religious festivities. It is a quasi-commercial zone that is located in the Lambayeque province, more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. 

She runs a general store from home, where she sells various basic need items, provisions, vegetables, and other perishable goods. Her customers choose her store because she always offers high-quality products and good customer service. This business allows her to help her husband maintain their household. 

Greicie would like to obtain more goods so that she can expand her business and meet customer demand. For this reason, she sees fit to request a 2,000.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can reach her goal.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Pedro Faustino

texts.es:
Pedro es un padre de familia de 47 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos  en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito de Las Lomas, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la región Piura y que se encuentra ubicado a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

El cuenta con una panadería y una bodega instalada en su domicilio. En la bodega el ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de uso diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. En la panadería el produce panes principalmente por la tarde. Pedro trata siempre de brindar a sus clientes productos de buena calidad y un buen trato por lo que cuenta siempre con una clientela fidelizada. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para solventar los gastos económicos de su familia.

Pedro desea adquirir más insumos y productos para ampliar sus negocios y percibir mayores ingresos que le permitan seguir creciendo como empresario y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Pedro is a 47-year-old family man, living with his wife and their two children in one of the rural communities of the Las Lomas department, a rural area of the Piura region located at more than three hours and a half from Chiclayo, the capital city of the Lambayeque region.

He runs a bakery and a shop he has established in his house. In the shop he sells to his customer a variety of everyday products, among which general merchandise products and groceries. In the bakery he produces bread, mainly during the afternoon. Pedro always tries to offer his customers good quality products and to treat them well, and this is why he can count on regular customers. The money he earns with these activities is used to cover the economic expenses of his family.

Pedro wishes to buy more ingredients and products to expand his activities and obtain better incomes that will allow him to keep on growing as a businessman and to improve his family’s quality of life. For this reason he has judged it necessary to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 700 PEN loan that will help him reach his goal.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients and products to expand his activities.

loans.name: Sourng

texts.en:
Sourng C., 63, is married and resides with his three children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. C. sells palm products, earning an income of USD 4 per day. His wife is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 80 on food and USD 30 on the other necessary expenses. 

C. is requesting a loan of USD 1050 to purchase a plot of farmland to improve the farming business. In the future, he would like to use the additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a plot of farmland to improve farming business

loans.name: Murere Ole

texts.en:
Murere Ole L. is 42 Years old, married and is a father of six children.  Murere is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last four years.

He learned about KADET from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is planning to spend and to prepare land for maize planting. Maize has been doing well in the area due to good climatic conditions.

He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.  Murere dream is to do large scale farming and be an exporter of maize overseas. He is a scrupulous man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to prepare land for maize planting.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en: Gregoria is 45 years old and has seven children, two of whom are grown while the other five are still in school. She is a member of the communal bank "Kausachun", which is in its 48th loan cycle. Gregoria has been a member of FINCA Peru for four years now. She has had a timber business for twelve years. She drives to the countryside, purchases wood, and then transports it to sell in a market in Ayacucho.

loans.use: To buy wood to sell

loans.name: Uk's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five members who have selected Mrs. U. to be the group leader. They will use their portions of the loan to improve their families' standard of living. 

Mrs. U. was born in 1968. She is married to Mr. Sin, and they have a child who is enrolled in local public school. 

Her husband is a construction worker and a farmer who owns a very small piece of land where he grows rice. He sells part of the rice yield and the other part he keeps to support his family. 

She is a silk weaver who can earn some profit from selling silk cloth to support her family. Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. So to achieve this purpose, Mrs. U. is seeking a loan to buy more silk for weaving.

loans.use: To buy more silk for weaving

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver G. is 56 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. He is from the village of Villa Victoria in Echague barangay, a part of Isabela province on the Luzon islands. Oliver is a farmer who plants and harvests rice for sale. Oliver has been in business for over thirty years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP every harvest season.

In 2010, Oliver joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. He is requesting a new loan, his second from ASKI, of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his farm.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en: Chhuon S., 37, makes a living by selling recycled goods and growing rice on farmland that she owns in the province of Kompong Cham. She sells her used goods to a wholesaler who sells them in bulk to other countries. These recycled items include wires, cans, bottles and plastic goods. Her husband works in construction and earns about $2 a day. Chhuon S. has three children, all of whom are in school. She is applying for this loan to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Hadi

texts.ar: هادي عمره 29 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في بيع الخضار والفواكه الموسمية له في عمله 5 سنوات يحب العمل يريد دائما ان يطور مستقبله وان يؤمن مستقبل جيد لأولاده يريد ان يزيد من مدخول محله وان يطور عمله يسعى الى تحسين الوضع المادي من خلال تحسين المحل وزيادة البضاعة فيه يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى تقوية المحل وشراء بضاعة يتميز يدقة في عمله يريد ان يطور محله حتى يصبح سوبر ماركت كبيرة تضم سلع غذائية كثيرة يهتم ثيرا في تعليم اولاده ويريد لهم المستقبل الجيد
texts.en: Hadi is 29 years old and married with three children. He works selling seasonal fruits and vegetables. He has five years of experience in his field, and he likes his work. He is always striving to improve his future and to secure a good future for his children. He would like to increase the revenues of his store and develop his business. He is trying to improve his financial situation by improving his store, in this case, by increasing his store's inventory. With a loan from al-Majmoua he would like to buy new goods for his store. He stands out in his field due to his attention to detail in business matters. He would like to develop his store into a supermarket which will sell all sorts of foodstuffs. He is very concerned with providing his children a good education, and he wants a good future for them.

loans.use: to buy seasonal vegetables for his grocery store.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman with three children aged 24, 20 and 7. She lives in the town of San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur.

Salome has been in the business of raising hogs for 10 years. Her income from her business differs each month but the highest she earned was 6.000 PHP. Salome also put up a sari-sari store to help augment her family’s income. The loan that she requested will be used to buy pig feed, vitamins and other supplies she needs for her piggery. Salome hopes for her businesses to be stable.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, vitamins and other supplies

loans.name: Selma

texts.en:
Selma is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fruit and vegetable selling business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase fruit and vegetables to sell.

Selma has been in this business for 8 years. Selma earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut and farming rice.

Selma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business and send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa earns a living through selling fish. Her husband is a fisherman and she helps him sell his catch. Their fishing business has been running for 7 years. Adelfa and her husband work together to feed their kids and send them to school. She requested a loan to buy fishing nets, hooks, and other materials. This loan will help Adelfa and her husband continue their business.

Adelfa is 35 years old and has three children ages 14, 12 and 7. She hopes for her children to be God-fearing and respectful children.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, hooks, and other materials.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is an honest and hardworking woman. She is married and has three children. Fotima has operated a business selling women’s fabrics for 10 years. She purchases fabrics wholesale and then sells them to her customers. Fotima works hard in order to better her living conditions. She started her business by selling small items. Fotima would like to get a loan of 6,500 TJS to purchase new fabrics and increase her working capital in order to make a good profit.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Ramcy

texts.en:
Ramcy is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 4 children. 

Ramcy has a rice & corn farm for agricultural business. He has had this business for 5 years. He has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fertilizer for the rice field. Ramcy is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Ramcy hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the rice field.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Gina has a shop that sells snacks, beverages and canned goods. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Gina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Lucia Pabla

texts.es: Lucia vive en L. ciudad D. BarranquilL. con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades D. 20 y 16 años respectivamente; allí tiene su negocio D. venta D. productos D. belleza, D. ropa y calzado en todas las líneas, el cual inició para apoyar L. gestión D. su esposo en el hogar, mediante L. generación D. ingresos independientes en un trabajo autónomo, que permitiera  responder D. manera simultánea a sus compromisos como madre y esposa.  Lucia en su negocio venD. mediante crédito, otorgando plazos pactados con sus clientes D. acuerdo con sus ingresos y es por esto que  su negocio goza D. gran aceptación D. parte D. ellos. Su credikiva es el segundo financiamiento que hace a L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará una vitrina y L. surtirá con mercancías, que aún tiene guardadas en cajas y también comprará artículos D. belleza que han encargado sus clientes y con ellos sería oportuna en dar respuesta. Su mayor fortaleza es su experiencia y su capacidad D. servicio, lo cual pronostica una inversión exitosa además D. que está hecha sobre pedidos D. clientes ya conocidos. Su mayor desafío es tener casa propia y ya ha accedido al programa D. construcción D. comunidades sostenibles, liderado por L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en Villas D. San Pablo, ubicado en L. ciudad D. BarranquilL.., con el cual se siente ilusionada  por llegar a  tener el subsidio D. vivienda tan anhelado
texts.en:
Lucia lives in the city of BarranquilL. with her husband and two children, ages 20 and 16 respectively. There she has a business selling beauty products, clothing, and shoes of all brands. She started this business with the intention of helping her husband with the household expenses and generating some self-employment income while fulfilling her responsibilities as a wife and mother. In her business, Lucia extends credit to her customers with terms that are based according to income level. This explains why her business has gained wiD. acceptance. This Kiva loan is her second occurrence of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She plans to buy a display cabinet and to restock with more merchandise. At the moment, everything is kept in boxes. She also plans to buy beauty products that her customers have ordered, so she wants to be able to fulfill their requests. Lucia’s greatest strengths are her experience and her ability to proviD. service, which are good indicators of a successful investment as evident by the many orders she has received from her existing customers.

Her greatest challenge is acquiring her own home, so she has already applied for the Construction Program of Sustainable Communities which is headed by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in Villas D. San Pablo, located in the city of BarranquilL.. Lucia is excited about receiving a housing subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a display cabinet and various types of merchandise to restock her business.

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en:
Inobat is a hard-working and responsible woman. She is married and the mother of one child. She is engaged in the farming business and she cultivates vegetables. Every day she gets up early and goes to her farm. Her crops are growing well and she wants to expand her business and increase her crops. 

Inobat would like to get a loan of 1000 USD for purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizers. She plans to use part of the loan for payment of her workers. She hopes that the lenders will support her. Thank you! 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and pay workers.

loans.name: Constance

texts.fr:
Notre cliente, âgée de 46 ans est  mariée et  mère de 5 enfants dont l’âge varie de 7 et 20ans.
La vente des friperies   a commencer avec sa grand mère, sa mère et enfin  ses sœurs et elle, c’est une affaire de famille qui va de génération en générations.
Ce quatrième crédit qu’elle va avoir avec Hope, va lui permettre de renforcer ce qu’elle a déjà acquis avec les trois premiers prêts.
Ces ventes journalières sont de 75000f quand les temps sont durs et de atteint 200.000F pendant les périodes favorables. Elle est parmi l'une  des  clients qui a plus épargnée.
Avec  l’actuel prêt, elle va acheter 1ballot des serviettes, 1ballot des draps, 1ballot des couettes, 1ballot des robes de soirées et ensemble  tailleurs dames  et ballots des coussins et poufs.
Toujours en quête des articles  de qualités   supérieures, elle vend presque tous les jours  en faisant des prix promotionnels pour  augmenter ses  revenus,   elle  diversifie ses marchandises pour attirer  de clients.
C’est une mère de famille très active  dans le commerce et très attentionné pour son époux et ses enfants.
Son but est  de vendre beaucoup, faire plus de bénéfices et acheter plus de marchandises, car son projet d’ouvrir un dépôt de vente de friperie en gros lui tient à cœur.
texts.en:
Our client is 46 years old, married, and the mother of five children, from 7 to 20 years old. Selling second-hand clothing began with her grandmother, then her mother, and finally her sisters and her. It is a family affair handed down from generation to generation. 

This fourth loan she is obtaining with HOPE will enable her to bolster what she has already acquired from the three previous loans. Daily sales amount to 75,000 francs when times are difficult, and they reach 200,000 francs when times are favorable. She is among those clients who have saved the most. 

With the current loan, she is going to buy a bale of napkins, a bale of bed sheets, a bale of comforters, a bale of evening dresses and women's ensembles, and some bales of pillows and floor cushions. 

Always seeking items of superior quality, she is able to sell something everyday by offering promotional prices for increasing her revenues. She is diversifying her merchandise to attract customers. 

Our client is a mother who is very active in commerce and very attentive to her husband and children. Her goal is to make many sales, to make more profit, and to buy more merchandise to sell because she holds dear to her heart a plan to open a warehouse selling used-clothing wholesale.

loans.use: to buy bales of bed sheets, napkins, floor cushions, women's ensembles, comforters, and pillows.

loans.name: Gabina

texts.es: La Sra. Gabina es madre soltera, su esposo la abandono y ella sola ha sabido salir adelante junto a sus hijos; la Sra. Gabina es una mujer muy emprendedora, luchadora, con muchas ganas de salir adelante; ella se dedica  a la venta de ropa, lleva en este negocio más de 2 años; sus principales clientes son sus vecinos y también vende en la feria dominical,  su principal desafío es la ausencia que ha causado el padre de sus hijos ya que sola tiene que sacar adelante a sus vástagos. El crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercadería de temporada (invierno). Sus sueños de la Sra. Gabina es tener su propia tienda de ropa y darles a sus hijos una buena educación. Ella está muy agradecida por el crédito otorgado ya que es una ayuda grande para el desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Gabina is a single mother.  Her husband left her and she has managed to get herself and her children ahead in life on her own.  Gabina is a very entrepreneurial and hard-working woman who has a great desire to get ahead.  Her business is selling clothes.  She has been in this business for more than two years.  Her main customers are her neighbors and she also sells in the Sunday market.  Her main challenge is the absence of her children's father since it means that she has to bring up her offspring herself.  

Gabina will invest her loan in buying more seasonal (winter) merchandise.  Her dreams are to own her own clothes store and to provide her children with a good education.  She is very grateful for the loan that she is being given as it will be a big help in developing her business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal (winter) merchandise

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel, originally from Argentina, knows the importance of good-tasting meat. In May 2010, he started a business buying “vegetal carbon” from South America and selling it to local supermarkets and stores in Florida. Vegetal carbon is a vegetable-based charcoal, which is 100% natural with no chemical additives. Hear it from him, in his own words: "You can take a piece of meat and bar-b-que it with normal charcoal and it will taste like chemicals and oil. Take that same piece of meat and cook it with natural vegetable charcoal and the meat smells and tastes completely different."

Since Miguel has been in business, he has been actively searching for the best ways to structure the business, where to import from and who to sell to. Miguel hopes to continue obtaining new sales and wants to become a large scale distributor of the product. He will use this loan as initial capital to import large quantities of charcoal and expand inventory.

loans.use: To import charcoal from Paraguay and sell it in the US.

loans.name: María Martha

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Las Flores, vive por la parroquia de Ricaurte lugar donde existe una gran variedad de comedores que ofrecen los platos típicos del sector, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales,  mantienen las tradiciones y cultura de sus padres.

La Señora. María tiene 46 años, es madre soltera de un hijo de 17 años de edad que está  estudiando en la universidad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive con sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
Doña María tiene una una tienda de comestibles hace 6 años, en la cual labora desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 6 años y los créditos le han permitido crecer en su negocio. El dinero de este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceites y otros productos de primera necesidad para su tienda.

Su meta es que su hijo se gradué de la universidad y sea un gran profesional.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Las Flores communal bank. She lives in the Ricaurte parish, an area where there are a great variety of eateries that serve regional dishes. The locals work in agriculture and breed animals, maintaining the traditions and culture of their parents. 

María is 46 years old and is a single mother of one 17 year old son who studies in the university. She doesn’t have her own home and lives with her parents with whom she shares the household costs. 

María has had a grocery store for 6 years, and she works from 6:00 in the morning until 10:00 at night. 

She has been in the communal bank for 6 years, and the loans have allowed her to grow her business. She will invest the money from this loan into the purchase of rice, sugar, noodles, oils, and other essential products for her store. 

Her goal is that her son will graduate from the university and become a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, oils, and other essential products

loans.name: Ulziibaatar

texts.en:
Ulziibaatar is 48 years old and lives with his wife and three kids in a house in Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. His wife is a teacher in a public school, and his eldest son is unemployed. Two others are college students. 

Ulziibaatar operates a welding business. He started his business in 2000. Now he makes makes iron ovens, doors and large garage doors as well. He is very well experienced and well known for his skill. He is a hard-working and diligent person who says, "I need raw materials due to high demand for my products and because I am planning to buy an apartment in the near future." He is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to buy materials to make cookers.

loans.use: To buy materials to make cookers.

loans.name: Shingimizi Group

texts.fr:
Joselyne est une commerçante âgée de 29ans qui habite  la localité de Bwoga en Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle vend les bananes depuis 10ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaire. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont 1 étudie.
 Le crédit Kiva  de 80,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantités de bananes  à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  communautaire« SHINGIMIZI».
texts.en:
Joselyne is a 29-year-old merchant living in Bwoga, a village in the province of Gitega in central Burundi. She has been selling bananas for ten years. She is also a farmer. She attended elementary school until sixth grade. She is married and the mother of three children, with one of them studying.

Joselyne will use her loan share of 80,000 Burundi francs provided through Kiva to increase her working capital and buy large quantities of bananas for resale. She expects to make a good profit.

Joselyne is a member of Shingimizi Community Group.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy large quantities of bananas for resale.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel de 47 años de edad, es casado, reside en su casa propia junto a su  familia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada  en la zona rural de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Es una zona agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

El cuenta con un terreno agrícola en donde suele sembrar limón, el ya tiene varios años de experiencia en esta actividad y durante este tiempo ha llegado a conocer mucho sobre el manejo de cultivos. También cría y vende aves de corral. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para solventar la economía diaria de su familia.

Manuel desea comprar fertilizantes y para  brindar mantenimiento a su terreno de cultivo para instalar una nueva plantación de limón. De esta manera obtendrá una buena cosecha. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Manuel is 47 years old, married, and lives in his own home with his family. The only service they receive is electricity. Manuel resides in the rural section of Tambogrande which is part of the Department of Piura. This area is known for farming, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

Manuel has a piece of land on which he grows lemons. He has several years of experience in this line of work. Throughout this entire time, he has gained much knowledge of how to maintain these crops. He also raises and sells poultry. The income he generates is used to cover the daily financial needs of his family.

Manuel wants to buy fertilizers and maintain his land so that he can plant a new crop of lemons and obtain a good harvest. In order to accomplish this goal, he is requesting a loan of 2000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for maintaining his land.

loans.name: Lena

texts.ru:
Лене 62 года. Она живет в Ванадзоре со своим мужем, который работает на заводе. Обе дочери Лены замужем и живут отдельно от родителей. 
Более 15 лет Лена занимается частным бизнесом: продажей женской одежды и белья. Лена арендует помещение на Ванадзорской центральной ярмарке, а товары она приобретает на Ереванских оптовых рынках. Лене очень нравиться заниматься бизнесом и помогать мужу содержать семью. У Лены много постоянных клиентов и поэтому ее товар раскупается очень быстро. 
Лена получала кредит от Нор Оризона 4 раза и сейчас ей необходим кредит на сумму 500.000 драм для приобретения зимнего ассортимента женской одежды и белья для своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Lena is 62 years old. She lives in Vanadzor with her husband who works at the factory. Both of Lena's daughters are married and live separately form their parents. For more then 15 years Lena has been in sales: she sells women's clothes and undergarments. Lena rents a store at the Vandzor central market and purchases her wares wholesale in Yerevan, the capital of Armenia. Lena likes managing her store and being able to help her husband support the family. She has many regular clients and her goods sell out quickly. 

Lena has taken a loan from Nor Horizon four times already and now she requested a loan of 500,000 dram to purchase a batch of winter clothes and undergarments for her store.

loans.use: To buy winter assortment of clothes and underclothes for her business

loans.name: Aviud De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Aviud a sus 49 años de edad, es propietario de una tienda ubicada en el occidente de la ciudad de Medellín, en la cual trabaja hace tres años. El señor Aviud tiene dos hijos de 8 y 15  años de edad. La tienda le provee los ingresos con los cuales puede llevar la responsabilidad de su hogar. El señor Aviud desea comprar surtido como papel higiénico, legumbres, snakcs, dulces, aceite, arroz, café, entre otros productos con los cuales aumente su inventario y pueda generar mayores ingresos. El señor Aviud desea tener su propio mini mercado para generar empleos directos en su comunidad y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Señor Aviud is 49 years old and owns a shop located in the west part of the city of Medellin, where he has worked for the last 3 years. Señor Aviud has 2 children aged 8 and 15 years. His shop is his source of income with which he covers the household expenses. Señor Aviud wants to buy a variety of products such as toilet paper, vegetables, snacks, pastries, oil, rice and coffee amongst others with which to increase his inventory and generate more income. Señor Aviud wants to have his own minimart to generate jobs for the community and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products such as toilet paper, fruit and vegetables, pastries, oil and coffee.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 34 years old, married to Alfonce, and has three school-going children aged between 3 and 14. She operates a retail shop in Tala, and earns a monthly profit of 10,000 KES. 
Rose has applied for a loan of 70,000 KES from Kiva partner KADET, and she plans to use the loan to buy more stocks of maize flour, beans, rice, sugar, and salt for sale during high season. She will save the anticipated profits and also provide for her family's basic needs. Rose hopes to grow her business and be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize flour, beans, rice, sugar, and salt.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: El señor Efrain a sus 45 años de edad es propietario desde hace dos años de una tienda en la cual además de la venta de alimentos, también realiza la comercialización de papelería, prendas de vestir y accesorios. El señor Efrain requiere de la compra de surtido para su tienda tal como productos de la canasta familiar y productos relacionados con la navidad y temporada escolar. Con lo anterior, el señor Efrain podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia y cumplir su sueño de tener un nuevo local para la venta de comidas rapidas y aprender del oficio de la panaderia.
texts.en: For two years Elfrain, forty-five, has owned a store where, in addition to selling food, he sells stationery, clothing, and accessories.  He needs to stock up on merchandise including staples and products for Christmas and the school year.  With his prior loan, Efrain was able to improve the quality of life for himself and his family and to realize his dream of having a new locale to sell his fast food and learn the bakery trade.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 34-years-old businesswoman who is married to Josphat, who is a businessman. They are blessed with four children. She has been running a retail shop for the past nine years with a monthly income of KES 15,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Esther will use the loan amount to buy more stock of sugar and rice for her shop. With the anticipated profits from the business she will educate children. 

Her dream is to open a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stock of sugar and rice for her shop.

loans.name: Mchata Group

texts.en:
Dominica, who is in her early 40s, is married and has one child who has completed school.  Dominica has been running a food vending business for 10 years now.  She works from 6:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Dominica's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her food stocks and for household expenses, and she has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants this loan to buy new utensils for her food business.  Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group, Mchata, which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy new utensils for her food business.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe DANAYA sont  essentiellement de femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33  ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à MEDINE un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur treizième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.
FATOUMATA 1ère à droite sur la photo fait le commerce de pagnes wax et real dans  ce groupe de femmes DANAYA. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 pièces de pagnes wax et real au prix d’en gros. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso ville et souvent à Bamako.
 Elle les revend au  de façon ambulante dans les quartiers de Sikasso ville et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et souvent à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35.250FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
There are four members of the Danaya group. Most of them are married, their average age is 33 and they have 4 children on average. The majority live in monogamous families in Médine, one of the working-class neighbourhoods of Sikasso, which is the third-largest administrative region of Mali. 

This is the group's third loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, and has been requested to help them satisfy their customer's needs. The previous loans have been repaid in full. 

Fatoumata, pictured on the right, sells wax and real pagnes (traditional printed cloth) as part of this group. With her loan, she would like to buy 10 pieces of wax and real pagnes wholesale. She buys her products at the Sikasso city market or at Bamako. She then resells the cloth on foot in the neighbourhoods of Sikasso city and to her family. Her customers are men and women, and often buy on credit. She is aiming to earn 35,250 FCFA per month, part of which will go towards paying off her loan, and part of which she will save.

loans.use: to buy wax pagnes (traditional printed cloth).

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie aged 47 years. She is married with 4 children aged  9 and 22 years.They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 8 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers of maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her savings.
